description: Nancy Drew, the girl detective who could pick a lock, play the bagpipes, tap Morse Code in high heels and drive her blue roadster like a Daytona champ, turns 90 next year.

title: A Spectrum of Spice at Birds of a Feather
description: In Williamsburg, Brooklyn, this Sichuan spot expands upon the offerings at its sister restaurant, Cafe China.

title: Sichuan Food, Bracing and Measured, in Brooklyn
description: At Birds of a Feather in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, a bowl of slippery, feather-light pork won tons in chile oil has a red ring suspended around its edge that, to the spice-averse, may look like a warning. But the heat arrives gently, the oil used sparingly in a special sauce thats more sweet and tangy than it is fiery. The chef, Ziqiang Lu, sprinkles the dish with a confetti of stir-fried dried chiles ground together with rattan peppercorns, a type of green Sichuan peppercorn so floral that it smells as if its in the process of blooming.

title: Read the Text Messages Between U.S. and Ukrainian Officials
description: The messages reveal new details about President Trumps efforts to use American foreign policy to benefit himself.

title: Take It to 11
description: Good morning. Ive spent the week making like Danny Meyer, the restaurateur, who many nights makes it his business to visit the dining rooms he maintains across the city, even as his Shake Shack empire expands across the nation.

title: Baratunde Thurstons Work Diary: At the Intersection of Tech, Race and Society
description: Since publishing How to Be Black, his best-selling 2012 satirical memoir about black identity in America, Baratunde Thurston has built himself into a one-man multimedia company. In recent years, his thoughts on race and technology have powered email newsletters (Recommentunde, with tips about what to read and stream), podcasts (Spit, about the surprising implications of DNA testing), TV shows (The Daily Show With Trevor Noah) and a regular magazine column (One More Thing, in Fast Company).

title: That Music Youre Dancing To? Its Code
description: On a computer, Sonic Pi looks like any other coding language. Its a mess of numbers, parentheticals, punctuation marks and keywords, splattered over an LCD screen. But offscreen  and through a set of quality speakers  those keystrokes produce music you might dance to on a Friday night.

title: PCOS Is More Than a Fertility Issue
description: I was recently diagnosed with PCOS, though Ive had symptoms for 20 years, and Im wondering why PCOS is looked at as a fertility issue and not an overall womens health issue. PCOS predisposes me to all sorts of health problems. Why didnt anyone care until I tried to get pregnant?

title: Who Is Gordon Sondland, and What Was His Mission to Ukraine?
description: BRUSSELS  Gordon D. Sondland, the blunt-spoken hotelier who is President Trumps ambassador to the European Union, was boasting on Ukrainian television that Mr. Trump had honored him with a special assignment  overseeing relations between the two countries at the highest levels.

title: Cars Are Death Machines. Self-Driving Tech Wont Change That.
description: The best way to make streets safer? Fewer cars.

title: Pope Francis Is Fearless
description: The Rev. James Martin, one of Americas most prominent Catholic priests, is a best-selling author, film consultant to Hollywood producers and a prolific tweeter with a digital pulpit that reaches more than 250,000 followers. Father Martin is also a hero to many L.G.B.T. Catholics for challenging church leaders to recognize the full humanity of gay people. His advocacy has made him a target of vicious online campaigns from far-right Catholic groups. Archbishop Charles Chaput of Philadelphia last month warned that Father Martin does not speak with authority on behalf of the church.

title: Warren and Sanders, and Their Messages of Change, Dominate the Money Race
description: LOS ANGELES  With Senator Elizabeth Warrens announcement on Friday that she raised $24.6 million in the past three months, the fund-raising picture for the leading Democratic presidential contenders has come into focus: Ms. Warren and Senator Bernie Sanders are in strong position to fund their campaigns over the long haul.

title: Adam Schiff Is the Right Man for the Moment
description: President Trump and House Republicans are trying to cast the House Intelligence Committee chairman, Adam Schiff of California, as the lead villain in a partisan impeachment reality show. The president has road-tested some nicknames, called for Mr. Schiffs resignation and accused him of treason, and is now trying to spin out a new conspiracy theory, suggesting that Mr. Schiff probably helped write the whistle-blower complaint. House Republicans have indicated that they intend to force a vote to condemn Mr. Schiff when they return from recess.

title: Teenagers in The Times: September 2019
description: The September edition of Teenagers in The Times is always bursting at the seams, thanks to the many back-to-school pieces across sections.

title: Brexit? What Brexit? The Art World Carries On Unfazed at Frieze London
description: LONDON  Britain might be convulsed by Brexit, but the contemporary art world, and the 0.1 percent of the population that makes it go around, carries on as normal. At least, so it seems.

title: Volker Gives New Details on Giulianis Role in Ukraine Policy
description: WASHINGTON  The former State Department special envoy for Ukraine told congressional investigators that Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trumps personal lawyer, demanded that Ukraine specifically commit to investigate involvement in the 2016 election and a firm tied to former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Review: After Ambitious Operas, the Philharmonic Exhales
description: After the adventure of last weeks ambitious staging of Erwartung and Bluebeards Castle, two operas the New York Philharmonic doesnt dust off every day, the orchestra and its music director, Jaap van Zweden, exhaled.

title: How Well Do You Know the Jokers Laugh?
description: Joaquin Phoenix is the latest actor to play Batmans cackling archnemesis, Joker. His predecessors include Cesar Romero, Jack Nicholson, Heath Ledger, Mark Hamill and Jared Leto. Can you tell whose devious laugh is whose?

title: Boris Johnson Will Ask for a Brexit Delay, Court Papers Say
description: LONDON  After vowing for weeks that Britain would leave the European Union on Oct. 31 with or without a deal easing the transition, the government said in documents released on Friday that Prime Minister Boris Johnson would ask for another delay if he failed to secure an agreement by mid-October.

title: N.Y.P.D. Officers Funeral Brings Commissioner and Comrades to Tears
description: MONROE, N.Y.  They came by the thousands  officers in ceremonial uniforms, officials in somber suits and navy dresses, friends, family members and strangers, dressed as much in grief as in actual fabric. They converged on a church in this small upstate town on Friday to mourn the untimely death of a young New York City police officer, described as a selfless hero who gave up a life of comfort for one of service.

title: Sam Darnold Out of Jets Game
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Quarterback Sam Darnold, who missed the Jets last two games because of mononucleosis, will not play this Sunday against the Eagles.

title: Sanders Said He Had a Common Heart Procedure. So Why the Mystery?
description: WASHINGTON  None of us know when a medical emergency will affect us, Senator Bernie Sanders wrote in a tweet from Desert Springs Hospital Medical Center on Wednesday, hours after the 78-year-old Democratic candidate for president experienced one.

title: Impeachment Investigators Subpoena White House and Ask Pence for Documents on Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  House impeachment investigators widened the reach of their inquiry on Friday, subpoenaing the White House for a vast trove of documents and requesting more from Vice President Mike Pence to better understand President Trumps attempts to pressure Ukraine to investigate his political rivals.

title: Heres How to Type Faster on Your Phone
description: For many of us, our approach to typing on a smartphone is something we stumble upon. Unlike composing words on a typewriter or computer keyboard, there is no widely taught, proper way.

title: Fry Some Eggplant Before the Season Is Done
description: Roasted and grilled eggplants are all well and good, but nothing beats the crisp skin and burnished flesh of eggplant thats been fried.

title: Read T a Poem | Colman Domingo
description: The actor reads Ed Bok Lees Summer Open Window (2019).

title: The Actor Colman Domingo Reads T a Poem
description: The actor, writer and director Colman Domingo, 49, has always loved poetry. I grew up on poems by E.E. Cummings, Langston Hughes, Maya Angelou, Nikki Giovanni and Paul Laurence Dunbar, he says. In addition to starring alongside Natalie Portman in the new film Lucy in the Sky, which follows an astronauts struggle to readjust to life on Earth after traveling into space, Domingo recently appeared on HBOs Euphoria and is a co-writer of the acclaimed Summer: Donna Summer the Musical, which is currently on tour across the U.S. When hes crafting narratives for any of his projects, whether hes in front of the camera or behind the scenes, he often returns to the words of his favorite writers. Poems influenced my love of craftsmanship in telling a story, he says, whether in short prose or long form. The works he revisits again and again have in common rich language, impeccable phrasing, soul stirring images, and wit, he says, and so it makes sense that for Ts video series Read T a Poem, he chose to recite a work by the South Korean-born American writer Ed Bok Lee, whose insightful, exacting poems reflect the intimate ways globalization is transforming our culture and our lives. Domingos selection, Summer Open Window, is from Lees latest collection, Mitochondrial Night, which uses DNA as a central theme in its lyrical exploration of genealogy, geography and time.

title: Terrorism Motive Eyed in Paris Police Stabbing Attack
description: PARIS  French antiterrorism prosecutors on Friday took over the investigation into the killing of four people the day before at Paris Police Headquarters, suggesting investigators were considering a possible terrorism motive.

title: Come One, Come All!
Ben Lerners New Novel and the Politics of Language
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: Getting the Jokers Laugh Just Right
description: For years, Andrea Romano gave a crucial note to actors who voiced the Joker on Batman: The Animated Series: Do not wear noisy shirts. It was rare that someone would come in to do the Joker voice for more than 20 minutes who didnt end up bathed in sweat. It requires a tremendous amount of energy, said Romano, who served as the voice and casting director for that show, Justice League and other animated series. You want to flail your arms around and not have a take ruined by the sound of clothing.

title: What Happened After the Joke: A Stand-Ups Harrowing Tale
description: If theres one thing comics want besides laughs, its to avoid being hack, which means, essentially, clich. But defining hack can be tricky. It varies from room to room and changes with the times, a moving target that requires vigilance and alertness to track. No one dodges it with as much persistence as Gary Gulman.

title: More Unrest as Hong Kong Protesters Defy Mask Ban
description: People took to the streets of Hong Kong to protest the governments decision to invoke emergency powers to ban face masks in an attempt to quell mass demonstrations.

title: Scientists Solve a Puzzle: Whats Really in a Fatberg
description: LONDON  When a giant fatberg was discovered in the sewer of a small coastal town in southwestern England last year, the company that manages the pipes was so mystified by the greasy mass of solidified fats and waste materials that it enlisted the help of scientists to discover what it was made of.

title: Demi Moore Shares a Peek Behind the Scenes of Her No. 1 Best Seller
description: Chances are, youve seen Demi Moore on a screen  a big one at the multiplex or a little one in your best friends basement. If youre a moviegoer of a certain age, you might trace your journey from adolescence to adulthood by the release dates of Moores greatest hits, from St. Elmos Fire to G.I. Jane.

title: Diahann Carroll, Actress Who Broke Barriers With Julia, Dies at 84
description: Diahann Carroll, who more than half a century ago transcended racial barriers as the star of Julia, the first American television series to chronicle the life of a black professional woman, died on Friday at her home in West Hollywood, Calif. She was 84.

title: Afghan Towns First Female Mayor Awaits Her Assassination
description: MAIDAN SHAR, Afghanistan  Zarifa Ghafari, who at 26 became one of Afghanistans first female mayors, has said that she fully expects to be assassinated.

title: The Chicken That May Sweep the Internet
description: I have a short running list of cooking projects in my head, the things I would do if I were living the long-baked lifestyle as opposed to the fast-cook one. At the top of the list, alongside pastries, is sourdough bread  good bread being a true love of mine. This is why our new guide to making sourdough bread is crying out to me and really is not to be missed. Its written by the extraordinary Claire Saffitz (of Bon Apptit test kitchen video fame), and it is thorough and helpful and approachable and sane. I also ate some of the test loaves, and frankly they were amazing.

title: The Myth of the Frivolous Female Spender
description: Youre reading In Her Words, where women rule the headlines. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox. Let us know what you think at inherwords@nytimes.com.

title: Afghan War Casualty Report: October 2019
description: At least 76 pro-government forces and 18 civilians were killed in Afghanistan during the past week. The deadliest attack took place Jowzjan Province, where a Taliban Red Unit attacked the Bala Hisar military base in Aqcha District, killing 20 soldiers, three pro-government militia members and one police officer. An additional five soldiers were taken prisoner, and 10 security forces were wounded in the course of the three-hour battle. The Taliban also seized four Humvees and 29 weapons from the base, which was recaptured after reinforcements arrived. In Takhar Province, insurgents attacked two security outposts in the villages of Qorogh and Khwaja Bandkasha, killing five police special forces and five pro-government militia members. Local authorities claimed that 12 Taliban members were also killed in the clash.

title: The Playlist: The Whos Defiant Postscript, and 14 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Trump, Facing Farmers Discontent, Plans Help for Ethanol
description: WASHINGTON  The Environmental Protection Agency and the Department of Agriculture jointly proposed new rules on Friday that would increase ethanol consumption at the expense of oil refineries to help corn and soybean farmers buffeted by President Trumps trade wars.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker, Kelly Ripa and Ryan Seacrest at the Ballet
description: Galas were held for the New York City Ballet, Carnegie Hall and the City Parks Foundation.

title: Stunt Aimed at Ocasio-Cortez Over Climate Change: Start Eating Babies
A Night at the Ballet
description: The New York City Ballet held its fall fashion gala on Sept. 26 at Lincoln Center. Carnegie Hall held its opening night gala on Oct. 3. And the City Parks Foundation, which provides activities and concerts in public parks, held its 30th anniversary gala on Sept. 26 in Central Park.

title: Iranian Hackers Target Trump Campaign as Threats to 2020 Mount
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The 2020 presidential election is still 13 months away, but already Iranians are following in the footsteps of Russia and have begun cyberattacks aimed at disrupting the campaigns.

title: Man Kills Estranged Wife With Car and Machete in the Bronx, Police Say
description: A man ran over his estranged wife with her car and then repeatedly slashed her with a machete in broad daylight on Thursday morning in the Bronx, the police said.

title: Britain Once Held All the Cards With Ireland. Brexit Turned the Tables.
description: LONDON  A day after Prime Minister Boris Johnson presented his plan to lead Britain out of the European Union  a dense farrago of details about customs unions, regulatory zones and borders running in two directions  Irelands prime minister, Leo Varadkar, offered a simple response: Why not just vote again?

title: Skateboardings Anti-Olympics
description: Its crazy high-level skateboarding, said Evan Eden, a member of the crowd at this years Live at Olympic Stadium in Montreal. He had traveled from New Jersey to see the annual spectacle, which in the last five years has become known as one of the most innovative and exciting events in the sport.

title: How the Yankees Became Baseballs Hardest-Hitting Team
description: The Yankees were dethroned as the home run kings of Major League Baseball this year, barely ceding the title to their divisional-round playoff opponents: The Minnesota Twins, who smashed a record 307 blasts to the Yankees 306.

title: An Outtake From The Daily: The Fear Facer
description: Julia Longoria, a producer for The Daily, consults 9-year-old Ella Maners about how to tackle a fear.

title: Scientist Who Discredited Meat Guidelines Didnt Report Past Food Industry Ties
description: A surprising new study challenged decades of nutrition advice and gave consumers the green light to eat more red and processed meat. But what the study didnt say is that its lead author has past research ties to the meat and food industry.

title: October Dreams, and Nightmares, Have Kept Nelson Cruz Coming Back
description: A ring sailed right over his head, and eight years later, Nelson Cruz is still trying to grab it.

title: Disney Bars Netflix TV Ads in Battle for Streaming Supremacy
description: LOS ANGELES  Dear Netflix: Keep your money.

title: On the Menu: Is It Really O.K. to Eat Meat?
description: To the Editor:

title: What to Wear to a World-Class Horse Jumping Show
description: Fun fact about show jumping: While the sport may never shake its elitist reputation, its the rare Olympic event where men and women compete against one another. Also true: Admission to last weekends Longines Global Champions Tour, which was on Governors Island in New York City and showcased some of the worlds top-ranked jumpers, was free.

title: Misty Copeland Leads the Charge at Fall for Dance
description: Misty Copeland inched toward the front of the stage with her powerful back leading the way. It wasnt the only time that Ms. Copeland, one of ballets brightest stars, showed her fans a different side of herself in Ash, a new solo by Kyle Abraham. But it set the tone.

title: The Veterinarian Will See Your Dinosaur Now
description: Dinosaurs loom large in the human imagination, towering above the treetops, bringing down prey and reigning over the ancient land, sea and sky.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. With so much going on in the news, you may have missed these excellent articles. You wont regret spending some time reading them.

title: Yannick Nzet-Sguin Leads a Revelatory Turandot
description: Last season, when Yannick Nzet-Sguins tenure as the Metropolitan Operas music director began, audiences had to wait more than two months for him to actually conduct something. It was worth the wait. He led a fresh, elegant and gripping account of Verdis La Traviata.

title: F.D.A. Approves New H.I.V.-Prevention Drug, but Not for Everyone
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved a new drug, Descovy, for prevention of infection with H.I.V., only the second drug approved for this purpose.

title: Prince Harry Goes to Battle With Tabloids, Rupturing an Old Relationship
description: LONDON  Prince Harry has started legal proceedings against the owners of two British tabloids over accusations that they hacked his phones, Buckingham Palace confirmed on Friday, opening a new front in a remarkable crusade against the British press.

title: Introducing Love Letter, a Newsletter About Love and Relationships
description: [This is the very first installment of the Love Letter newsletter. Sign up here to receive it in your inbox. ]

title: Scientists on Arctic Expedition Choose Ice Floe Thatll Be Home for a Year
description: Two weeks after leaving northern Norway for the Central Arctic, and with the polar darkness settling in, an icebreaker carrying climate researchers settled next to an ice floe on Friday, putting itself at the mercy of the drifting ice for a planned yearlong expedition to better understand the changing Arctic climate.

title: Treasury Inspector General to Review Handling of Trumps Tax Returns
description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Departments inspector general is investigating how the department handled a congressional request for President Trumps tax returns, which Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin has refused to turn over.

title: When My Louisiana School and Its Football Team Finally Desegregated
description: EUNICE, La.  Before two-a-day football practices began in August 1969, Coach Joe Nagata gathered some of his white senior players at Eunice High School. He told them to prepare for workouts more difficult than usual in heat and humidity that felt like damp clothes inside a dryer.

title: Mordicai Gerstein, Illustrator of Magical Worlds, Dies at 83
description: Mordicai Gerstein, a writer, illustrator and master storyteller whose books created magical worlds where young readers could ponder big questions, died on Sept. 24 at his home in Westhampton, Mass. He was 83.

title: Former Italian Prime Minister Says Hes Suing Trump Aide for Slander
description: FERRARA, Italy  What was once a conspiracy theory on Americas far-right fringe has developed into a furtive international investigation by the Trump administration and a political headache, and opportunity, for Italys bickering leaders.

title: Trump Claims Texts Prove No Quid Pro Quos of Any Kind With Ukraine. But His Ambassador Suspected One.
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump insisted on Friday that there was nothing inappropriate about his administrations dealings with Ukraine, playing down a series of texts between American diplomats and a Ukrainian official that were released Thursday night that outlined his attempt to tie a possible White House meeting and military aid to investigating former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.

title: Australia Just Had a Bad Flu Season. That May Be a Warning for the U.S.
description: Australia had an unusually early and fairly severe flu season this year. Since that may foretell a serious outbreak on its way in the United States, public health experts now are urging Americans to get their flu shots as soon as possible.

title: Old Masters and Fresh Surprises at the New York Film Festival
description: The New York Film Festival, now at its midpoint, is a grand, institutional affair. What the selection committee agrees is the best of world cinema  work from established masters and up-and-coming auteurs  assembles at Lincoln Center, along with judiciously selected documentaries, repertory offerings and experimental films. (Tickets are still available at Filmlinc.org.) Thats the big picture, anyway, or the comprehensive version of the story. It began last week with Martin Scorseses The Irishman and ends next weekend with Edward Nortons Motherless Brooklyn, with Noah Baumbachs Marriage Story as the designated centerpiece.

title: How the Yankees Won Game 1 of the A.L.D.S.
description: Yankees fans, spoiled by 27 World Series trophies, might be frustrated by their teams decade-long drought without adding another title. But consider the plight of Minnesota Twins fans when they learned of their teams first-round postseason opponent.

title: Trump Administration Unveils More Cuts to Food Stamp Program
description: WASHINGTON  The Agriculture Department moved again this week to cut spending on food stamps, this time proposing changes that would slice $4.5 billion from the program over five years, trimming monthly benefits by as much as $75 for one in five struggling families on nutrition assistance.

title: Su Beng, a Father of Taiwan Independence, Dies at 100
description: Su Beng, a revolutionary widely known as the father of Taiwan independence for his efforts to liberate the island from colonial rule, died on Sept. 20 in Taipei, the capital. He was 100.

title: Flash Drought in the South Brings Record Heat Without Rain
description: It was a hot summer in the American South, and droughts have affected tens of millions of people there after one of the driest and hottest Septembers on record.

title: Karel Gott, Pop Singer Called Sinatra of the East, Dies at 80
description: Karel Gott, a romantic Czech crooner whose popularity behind the Iron Curtain helped earn him the nickname Sinatra of the East, died on Tuesday  at his home in Prague. He was 80.

title: Melissa Barrera Goes from Mexican Telenovelas to Vida Star
description: Melissa Barrera

title: North Korea Blocks Windows of Tall Buildings in Pyongyang to Prevent Spying, Reports Say
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea has blocked the windows of high-rise apartments in Pyongyang, its showcase capital city, to prevent residents from looking down, or spying, on the party and government buildings where its top leader, Kim Jong-un, conducts business, a news report said Friday.

title: Podcasts for Horoscopes, Adulting and Phish Fans: Heres Whats New
description: Several new podcasts have quickly earned popularity on podcast charts. Top of the Apple charts this month is NBC Newss newest venture into audio, The Thing About Pam, from Keith Morrison and the Dateline team, which demonstrates corporate medias continued experimentation with the audio-only form. But here are some other newcomers that could be worth your time  whether youre a musical kid, a lover of mafia history, a cosmic believer, curious about classical music, concerned about gentrification and the environment or a Phishhead.

title: The Trump Era: Something New and Ugly Every Day
description: To the Editor:

title: Diahann Carrolls Tony Award Acceptance Speech
description: Diahann Carroll won the Tony Award for best actress in a musical for her role in No Strings, playing an American fashion model living in Paris.

title: With P.K. Subban, Devils Seek Wins on the Ice and in the Ticket Office
description: NEWARK  P.K. Subban played against the Devils 22 times over his first nine N.H.L. seasons, but he knew virtually nothing about New Jersey before he arrived in July, one month after being traded here by the Nashville Predators.

title: Twin Births in the U.S. Are Dropping, and Experts Have a Theory
description: The twin birthrate has declined in the United States after rising for years, a new report said this week. One theory researchers have put forward to explain the change is that fertility therapies that previously involved transfers of multiple embryos are less common.

title: A Different Kind of Guest
description: Our first-ever episode for kids told the story of Elsa and Clio Moock, 10-year-old twin sisters at an unexpected crossroads. Both were enrolled in the Girl Scouts. Elsa wanted to leave to join the Boy Scouts, a sudden possibility because of major changes the organization was making. Clio wanted to stay in the Girl Scouts.

title: Elizabeth Warren Campaign Fires Staff Member for Inappropriate Behavior
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts fired her national organizing director after multiple complaints regarding inappropriate behavior, according to a statement released Friday by her communications director.

title: PayPal Pulls Out of Libra, Facebooks Cryptocurrency Project
description: SAN FRANCISCO  PayPal said on Friday that it had pulled out of the coalition of companies involved in a Facebook-backed cryptocurrency initiative, in the latest headache for the social networks effort.

title: T Suggests: A Pioneering French Designer, a New All-Day Cafe and More
description: Over a century after her birth, the French designer Charlotte Perriand is finally getting her due. A retrospective of the pioneering avant-garde architect, who changed the course of 20th-century design with her elegant, industrial-inspired interior design and furniture, is now open at the Fondation Louis Vuitton in Paris. Charlotte Perriand: Inventing A New World features 200 of her designs, alongside the work of 15 artists from her time (for example, the French modernist Fernand Lger, whose artwork she sometimes featured in her interiors) and seven designers from her era, including the self-taught architect and metal worker Jean Prouv. While Perriand may be best known for the Chaise Longue Basculante B306  an adjustable steel lounge chair that she created in 1928 while working at Le Corbusiers studio in her 20s  her contributions also include a prefabricated mountain resort in Savoie, France, asymmetrical wooden bookcases that call to mind paintings by Piet Mondrian and a necklace made of oversize ball bearings. People keep thinking shes a woman who designed just a few chairs with Le Corbusier, says Sbastien Cherruet, a co-curator of the exhibition. Its not fair and doesnt do justice to her work.

title: A New History Celebrates Brooklyns Heights, and Depths
description: BROOKLYNThe Once and Future CityBy Thomas J. Campanella

title: Impeachment, Prince Harry, Diahann Carroll: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: You Will Be Shocked by This Article
description: On many websites, readers who scroll to the very end of an article are likely to encounter rows of small advertisements belonging to a weird subgenre of digital marketing known as chumbox ads.

title: 10 Tips to Avoid Leaving Tracks Around the Internet
description: Google and Facebook collect information about us and then sell that data to advertisers. Websites deposit invisible cookies onto our computers and then record where we go online. Even our own government has been known to track us.

title: Trumps Call to China to Investigate Biden Could Complicate Trade Talks
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps public call for the Chinese government to investigate a political rival could complicate next weeks trade talks, which are set to resume Thursday when American and Chinese negotiators meet in Washington to see if they can find a path to a trade deal.

title: In the Land of Self-Defeat
description: CLINTON, Ark.  Inside Washington, theres a sense that this scandal really is different. Even the White Houses memorandum of the phone conversation President Trump had with the Ukrainian president in July makes it clear that Mr. Trump asked a foreign country to help him undermine a political rival. But while national polls show support for impeaching him is growing, its still divided sharply along partisan lines. Democrats strongly favor it, while Republicans tend to oppose it.

title: Dalilah Muhammad Breaks Her Own World Record in the 400-Meter Hurdles
description: DOHA, Qatar  Dalilah Muhammad had no idea whether she had even won when she crossed the finish line on Friday night at Khalifa International Stadium. She had to look at the scoreboard to learn the results, she said, and it was only then that she realized what she had accomplished.

title: Andrew Scheer Has Fans. Can They Make Him Canadas Prime Minister?
description: BRAMPTON, Ontario  Canadas Conservative Party leader arrived in his campaign bus for a rally in the Toronto suburb of Brampton as a sparse crowd of about 150 milled about the venue, a largely empty parking lot.

title: Osaka vs. Andreescu: Tennis Rivalry in the Making?
description: Womens tennis has so much going for it: new stars from different continents, week-to-week suspense, and grande dame Serena Williamss ongoing quest for a 24th major singles title.

title: For Rocco Baldelli, Managing the Twins Is a Team Effort
description: Derek Shelton knows midges. Twelve years ago, Shelton, now the Minnesota Twins bench coach, stood in Clevelands home dugout as the Indians hitting coach when the winged insects swarmed in off Lake Erie, disrupting Game 2 of an American League division series. Yankees reliever Joba Chamberlain couldnt handle the infestation, and the Yankees lost the game and ultimately the series.

title: The Trump Impeachment Inquiry: What Happened Today
description: Welcome to the Impeachment Briefing, a special edition of the Morning Briefing that explains the latest developments in the House impeachment inquiry against President Trump. Sign up here to get the briefing by email every weeknight.

title: Saudi Arabia and Iran Make Quiet Openings to Head Off War
description: After years of growing hostility and competition for influence, Saudi Arabia and Iran have taken steps toward indirect talks to try to reduce the tensions that have brought the Middle East to the brink of war, according to officials from several countries involved in the efforts.

title: Pierre Le-Tan, Illustrator With a Quiet Touch, Dies at 69
description: The moon shines through a window, its light falling on a chair and a table holding a bottle and three tomatoes.

title: Bernie Sanders Had Heart Attack, His Doctors Say as He Leaves Hospital
description: Senator Bernie Sanders had a heart attack this week, his presidential campaign said on Friday as he left a Las Vegas hospital, following three days of near silence from the candidate and his advisers about his health.

title: Atlanta Asks Google Whether It Targeted Black Homeless People
description: Atlanta officials are seeking answers from Google after a news report said that company contractors had sought out black homeless people in the city to scan their faces to improve Googles facial-recognition technology.

title: Inequality in School Sports, and Beyond
description: To the Editor:

title: Testimony and Evidence Collected in the Trump Impeachment Inquiry
description: The status of the documents and witness testimony being collected by congressional investigators.

title: At the Bronx Zoo, She Taunted a Lion. Now Shes Taunting Police.
description: In its miniature savanna in the Bronx on Friday, a lion basked in both the sunshine and his newfound fame.

title: Amber Guygers Judge Gave Her a Bible and a Hug. Did That Cross a Line?
description: The trial was over at last. After days of emotional testimony in a case that gripped and divided the nation, a white former Dallas police officer had been sentenced to 10 years in prison for murdering a black man in his own apartment. The shouts of protest that had filled the courthouse hallways had quieted. Everyone was getting ready to go home.

title: Paul Badura-Skoda, Who Could Make a Piano Sing, Dies at 91
description: Paul Badura-Skoda, an Austrian pianist who was known for insightful interpretations of classical era repertory and who had one of largest discographies of any major pianist, more than 200 recordings, died on Sept. 25 in Vienna. He was 91.

title: Trump Governs by Grudge in California
description: In 1961, at a news conference three years before he became the Republican presidential nominee, the right-wing Arizona senator Barry Goldwater, surveying the progressive tendencies of voters in New York and its neighbors, was moved to observe: Sometimes I think this country would be better off if we could just saw off the Eastern Seaboard and let it float out to sea.

title: What They Left Behind: Colorama, Body Parts and Earth Works
description: Obituaries in The New York Times give account of the lives of the people around us  what they accomplished and how they lived  and reading them can be an exercise in discovering, or rediscovering, the marvelous things they created.

title: Facing Fresh Revelations, Republicans Struggle to Mount a Defense of Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Republican leaders are struggling to settle on a clear message and effective strategy for responding to Democrats aggressive and fast-moving impeachment investigation of President Trump, thrown off by early stumbles and a chaotic White House that have upended efforts to set a steady tone.

title: Hundreds Arrested in Ecuador Unrest
description: QUITO, Ecuador  Angry demonstrations over Ecuadors elimination of fuel subsidies widened on Friday, paralyzing much of the country for the second consecutive day as protesters in the capital clashed with riot police officers who used tear gas and armored cars to disperse them. Hundreds of people were reported arrested.

title: The Rays Got Verlandered. Join the Club.
description: HOUSTON  Justin Verlander loomed over the American League wild card game on Wednesday night, and his Houston Astros did not even play in it. The Tampa Bay Rays did, in Oakland, and their victory earned them a date with Verlander, who is only the greatest pitcher in the history of the division series.

title: Trump and His Henchmen in the Flames
description: We all know President Trump couldnt find Ukraine on a map, let alone find Finland, that happy country (the worlds happiest, according to a United Nations agency) whose happiness Trump this week attributed to the following: You got rid of Pelosi, and you got rid of shifty Schiff.

title: Elaine Feinstein, Poet, Novelist and Biographer, Dies at 88
description: Elaine Feinstein, a multifaceted British poet, novelist and biographer who found inspiration in her Jewish heritage and the work of female Russian poets, died on Sept. 23 in London. She was 88.

title: 2nd Official Is Weighing Whether to Blow the Whistle on Trumps Ukraine Dealings
description: WASHINGTON  A second intelligence official who was alarmed by President Trumps dealings with Ukraine is weighing whether to file his own formal whistle-blower complaint and testify to Congress, according to two people briefed on the matter.

title: Who will be Canadas next prime minister? Look to the lawn signs
description: I spent part of this week watching Andrew Scheer, the Conservative leader and Prime Minister Justin Trudeaus top rival. And it was a week during which it became Mr. Scheers turn to be caught in this elections seeming obsession with party leaders past lives, rather than the issues. Most Canadians probably now know more than they want about Saskatchewans licensing requirements for insurance brokers.

title: Trumps Future and the Clinton Precedent
description: I came of age as a conservative in an era when Republicans were keen on matters of private virtue and public probity. Then Bill Clinton became president, and his behavior exemplified neither.

title: Trump Will Deny Immigrant Visas to Those Who Cant Pay for Health Care
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration will deny visas to immigrants who cannot prove they will have health insurance or the ability to pay for medical costs once they become permanent residents of the United States, the White House announced Friday in the latest move by President Trump to undermine legal immigration.

title: Triumphant Cry
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  The funniest thing about todays Trenton Charlson grid is that its only a couple of letters shy of a pangram  seems that X and lowly little F could have been sneaked in someplace. If youre a letter person who notices such things, then you recognize Mr. Charlson as a kindred spirit, and youre probably exulting over the diagonal run up the middle today. But there are also two excellent spans and a number of interesting juxtapositions.

title: Corrections: October 5, 2019
description: ARTS

title: Quotation of the Day: Afghan Towns First Female Mayor Awaits Her Assassination
description: I didnt believe I could get this job, because I am a person with neither political power nor gold. But when I did, I knew I wanted to be here and try to change society.

title: Episode 5: The Land of Our Fathers, Part 1
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via Google Podcasts | Via Stitcher

title: British Man and Filipino Woman Abducted in Philippines
description: MANILA  A British businessman and his Filipino wife have been abducted in the southern Philippines, where Islamic militants have been known to seize foreigners and missionaries for ransom, the police and the military said on Saturday.

title: Five-Alarm Fire at Bronx Apartment Building Injures 10
description: A five-alarm fire engulfed the top floor of a Bronx apartment building on Friday night, injuring 10 people  two of them seriously  and prompting more than 200 firefighters to respond, the authorities said.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Austin City Limits and The Talented Mr. Ripley
description: AUSTIN CITY LIMITS 11 p.m. on PBS (check local listings). The blues guitarist and Austin native Gary Clark Jr. opens the 45th season of this long-running live concert series, performing music from his latest album, This Land, which was a New York Times Critics Pick. Later on in the season, music fans can catch hourlong performances from Maggie Rogers, H.E.R. and Vampire Weekend.

title: An Eerie Quiet and Dread as Hong Kong Face-Mask Ban Takes Effect
description: HONG KONG  With its subways paralyzed and its shopping malls shuttered, Hong Kong was anxious and eerily quiet on Saturday.

title: China Masters Political Propaganda for the Instagram Age
description: Lu Yingxin has been singing My People, My Country for the past week. An earnest propaganda anthem from 1985, the song typically wouldnt stand a chance against Taylor Swift, K-pop and other modern tunes the 18-year-old college student and her friends like to listen to.

title: Australian Couple Detained in Iran Are Released, Authorities Say
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  An Australian couple detained in Iran for several months have been released and are being reunited with their families after charges against them were dropped, the Australian authorities confirmed on Saturday.

title: China Loves News About Trumps Controversies. Not This Time.
description: BEIJING  Since a trade war broke out with the United States, Chinas state-run media has not held back from commenting on the swirl of political controversies around President Trump. At least, not until now.

title: Why French Montana Wears Robes and Slathers on Baby Oil
description: French Montana, 34, knows how to hustle. Born in Morocco, raised in the South Bronx and now living in Calabasas, Calif., he made a name for himself with self-released mixtapes, before he collaborated with rappers including Rick Ross, P. Diddy and Drake. On the eve of the release of his third studio album, Montana, he talked about how he stays fit and healthy, both mentally and physically.

title: New Yorkers Will Have to Wait for an East River Pool
description: In 2011, media outlets began heralding a fantastical urban design project to be built in New York. A group of young designers and architects had dreamed up plans for a floating, self-filtering swimming pool on the East River, allowing New Yorkers to swim legally and safely in the polluted waterway for the first time in 70 years. The pool would be roughly Olympic size (164 feet by 164 feet) and shaped like a giant plus sign. It would be named Plus Pool, rendered as +POOL.

title: Help! Im Stuck on a Train and My Plane Is Leaving Without Me
description: Sadly, youre right  you did lose the value of your Icelandair ticket. But despite what you were told, its not because you checked in online. You could theoretically check in from Mars and still change your flight afterward. What matters most is your whereabouts  and ticket status  when the plane actually departs.

title: Playing Catch a Killer With a Room Full of Sleuths
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif.  On a recent afternoon, under two giant chandeliers, some of the key people responsible for the future of crime and privacy tried to solve a murder.

title: Bernie Sanders Has a Heart Attack: This Week in the 2020 Race
description: It was another busy week in Washington and on the campaign trail. Here is our quick rundown of what happened in the 2020 race.

title: A Caricature of the Patriarchy: Argentine Feminists Remake Tango
description: BUENOS AIRES  Liliana Furis ruby red flat shoes glided across the dance floor in swift, assured moves, making her baggy pants sway gently.

title: Hurricane Chasers: An Immigrant Work Force on the Trail of Extreme Weather
description: CALLAWAY, Fla.  They arrived by the hundreds last year after Hurricane Michael sliced through the Florida Panhandle, packing 160-mile-per-hour winds that snapped pine trees in half, mangled steel posts, ripped off roofs and upended peoples lives. Without electricity, potable water or reliable accommodation, a rapid-response labor force got to work carting away the wreckage.

title: Taliban and U.S. Envoy Meet for First Time Since Peace Talks Collapsed
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Taliban officials have met in Pakistan with the top American diplomat who recently led peace negotiations with them, current and former members of the insurgent group said on Saturday.

title: A Classical Duo Nerding Out on the Cosmos
description: Larisa Martinez and Joshua Bell were married Oct. 5 at their home in Mount Kisco, N.Y. David Brooks, a friend of the couple and a New York Times columnist based in Washington who is a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: They Believed in Each Other
description: Demetrice Deshay Elmore and Joseph Joy LeMieux are to be married Oct. 6. Grady D. King, a minister of the Church of Christ, is to officiate at the San Sophia Overlook, an events space at the Telluride Ski and Golf Resort in Telluride, Colo.

title: Magical Chemistry Quick-Brewed in a Coffee Shop
description: Michelle Angulo and Staff Sgt. Maxamillian Alexander Dutton were married Oct. 2 at Waterfront Park in Alexandria, Va. The Rev. Jeffrey L. Maszal, a United Church of Christ minister, officiated.

title: He Was Canadas Clark Kent. Then Police Say He Went Rogue.
description: OTTAWA  The trail that led investigators to one of Canadas elite cybercrime experts, a quiet analyst in the national police, began with an email.

title: Garden of Solace
description: Four years ago, during my familys third move in six years, I felt like I was slowly unraveling. My husband had lost his job in Austin, Tex., and was offered a new one in the Philadelphia suburbs, so we trucked our two children, two cats and an embarrassing amount of stuff cross-country to start our lives over from scratch. I tried to sound optimistic to our new neighbors: Moving is hard, but were excited to put down roots here. Ive never lived in suburbia, but I love the giant trees. Inwardly, I howled: What have we done? Ive lost all my friends! Screw the trees!

title: In Chinatown, Rampage Against Sleeping Homeless Men Leaves 4 Dead
description: The killer first struck just before 2 a.m. on Saturday on a quiet spot on East Broadway in Chinatown, sneaking up on three homeless men as they slept on a sidewalk and bludgeoning them to death with a rusty, three-foot metal bar, the police said.

title: For Braves and Cardinals, the Managers Are Company Men
description: ATLANTA  For just a few moments on Thursday afternoon, in a makeshift room of microphones and klieg lights and portable air-conditioners, the baseball mens voices seemed to catch.

title: Deaths Mount as Protests Catch Iraqi Government Off Guard
description: When peaceful protesters poured into the Iraqi streets this past week, demanding an end to widespread government corruption, unemployment and a lack of basic services, the government was caught off guard.

title: The Sexist Undertones of Wedding Marketing
description: Laurie Vazquez, a 36-year-old marketing manager in New York City, had decided to keep her last name after she got married in June. But not everyone seemed to be on board with these plans.

title: Is 100 gecs the End of Pop, or a New Beginning?
description: One of 2019s unlikeliest underground-music breakthroughs has been 100 gecs, the duo of Dylan Brady and Laura Les, who make high-energy, quasi-slapstick, genre-jumbling electro-pop with shards of screamo, dubstep, glitch and big-room club music. Its fascinating and disorienting, and also some of the savviest pop music of the year.

title: A Provocateur of the Hong Kong Protests Gains Growing Stature
description: HONG KONG  From afar, the red brick sidewalk along Kings Road in Hong Kong appears to be covered with a mottled white carpet that stretches for dozens of yards. Closer up, the white reveals itself to be a mosaic made up of sheets of paper glued to the pavement, each featuring a bespectacled man with a self-confident smile.

title: Can I Make My Co-op Change the Bad Lobby Art?
description: Q: Our Upper West Side co-op decided that we should have a rotating display of art in our lobby, with works chosen by a committee of three. Were a large co-op with hundreds of residents. While some of the pieces have been O.K., others have been awful. Bad art isnt just an affront to the senses, its bad business. Many of us would prefer to have permanent dcor, but neither the board nor the managing agent seem willing to listen, and I was told I couldnt circulate a petition. What can we do to make our voices heard?

title: In Qatar, Track and Fields Championships Limp to the Finish
description: DOHA, Qatar  There are at least 30 million reasons to explain how Qatar persuaded global track and fields governing body to hand over its most prized event, the biennial world championships, to a tiny Persian Gulf state with the worlds largest natural gas reserves.

title: Jumbo Shrimp and Lobster Tails: D.C.s Fund-Raising Hot Spots
description: WASHINGTON  Night after night in Washington, you can find lobbyists and deep-pocketed donors plowing through chafing-dish chow at political fund-raisers held at the citys hot spots, like James Beard-awarded outposts and waterfront behemoths. Filings with the Federal Election Commission, in which federal candidates report campaign financial activity, show what a big business it is.

title: Alison Romans Tangy Sheet-Pan Chicken Is #1
description: This weekend, make Alison Romans vinegar chicken with crushed olive dressing (above)  our most popular recipe right now  Parmesan white bean soup, linguine with clam sauce or any of recipes in the collection below.

title: These Republicans May Not Endorse an Impeachment Inquiry. But They Arent Saying No.
description: RENO, Nev.  Representative Mark Amodei was not prepared for the backlash from his fellow Republicans when he said Congress needed to follow the facts and look into whether President Trump should be impeached.

title: Diahann Carroll Embodied Glamour and Substance
description: I am an 80s kid. I grew up in a New Jersey suburb that, to my minds eye, bore more than a passing resemblance to the fictional town in Stranger Things. While I enjoyed shows like Square Pegs and movies like The Breakfast Club, I was perplexed by how homogeneous they were, especially since my high school had nearly an even balance of black and white kids.

title: Max Scherzer Stifles the Dodgers in a Rare Relief Outing
description: LOS ANGELES  Max Scherzer said he had not even worked up a sweat when he trotted out of the Washington Nationals bullpen late Friday night. Hes used to warming up when the sun is still out, after all.

title: The Never Trump Coalition That Decided Eh, Never Mind, Hes Fine
description: WASHINGTON  In 2016, Erick Erickson could not have been clearer. Donald Trump was a racist and a fascist. It was no wonder, Mr. Erickson wrote, that so many people with swastikas in their Twitter profile pics supported him. I will not vote for Donald Trump. Ever, he insisted, adding his voice to the chorus of Never Trump Republicans.

title: You Dont Have to Give Until It Hurts
description: This week, Adam Grant and Allison Sweet Grant told us we need to talk about The Giving Tree. Why? Because if you assume the story is about generosity, its easy to learn the wrong lessons: that its O.K. for a child to take selfishly, and that adults should give until it hurts  and keep giving until they literally have nothing left to offer. Welp. Speaking of giving all of yourself to all of the things, we published our guide to time management for new parents who go back to work.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  This species of Sunday Variety puzzle is growing on me, I guess, like a fungus. It is gratifying to encounter something in life and realize after several iterations that somehow you are getting better at it, without really putting your shoulder into it, as it were. Like moving to a walk-up apartment and realizing after a few months that you do not even notice the hike upstairs. Anyway, consider this encouragement if you are struggling with todays Fred Piscop construction  trust me, if you keep at it you will get the hang of it too.

title: Biden Faced His Biggest Challenge, and Struggled to Form a Response
description: WASHINGTON  Joseph R. Biden Jr.s presidential campaign was under attack, and he and his advisers were torn over what to do.

title: Pieces of the Health Care Puzzle
description: To the Editor:

title: What Happened in the Trump Impeachment Inquiry This Week
description: Developments in the House impeachment inquiry were fast and furious this week. It was hard to keep up, even for those of us who are paid to do it. Heres a breakdown of important articles you may have missed.

title: The Greening of Paris Makes Its Mayor More Than a Few Enemies
description: PARIS  All over Paris, streets have been dug up and cut in two, and old paving stones overturned to build dozens of miles of bike lanes. A major urban highway has been closed to cars and turned over to pedestrians. Paris is readying feverishly for an emergency that, in the minds of the city and its mayor, is already here.

title: Senior Border Patrol Agent Faces Charges of Sexually Assaulting Colleague
description: The Border Patrol has struggled for years to recruit more women and help them advance through the agencys ranks, which have long been dominated by men. Only about 5 percent of the nations nearly 20,000 Border Patrol agents are women, and it was not until 2017 that a woman was named the Border Patrols acting chief, a first in the agencys nearly century-long history.

title: The Ukrainian Ex-Prosecutor Behind the Impeachment Furor
description: KIEV, Ukraine  As soon as he got the invitation from Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trumps personal lawyer, it was abundantly clear to him what Mr. Trumps allies were after.

title: The W.N.B.A. Finals Biggest Star May Be on the Sun: Jonquel Jones
description: Jonquel Jones smiled mischievously when asked if she and Curt Miller, head coach of the Connecticut Sun, had discussed her paltry eight shot attempts in the teams loss to the Washington Mystics the day before in the first game of the W.N.B.A. finals.

title: Earthquake in Bay Area Shakes San Francisco
description: The Bay Area was jolted Saturday morning when a minor earthquake struck about 10 miles from San Francisco.

title: Harvey Weinstein Told Me He Liked Chinese Girls
description: Harvey Weinstein told me he liked Chinese girls. He liked them because they were discreet, he said  because they knew how to keep a secret. Hours later, he attempted to rape me.

title: World Leaders Once Made Miracles, and Can Again
description: We need a little uplift, a reminder that although world leaders today from Washington to London to Beijing may be dishonest vandals, it doesnt have to be that way.

title: Now the Rich Want Your Pity, Too
description: Seems like its getting tough at the top. The winners in Americas meritocracy are suffering. Children in affluent homes are being hothoused through childhood, stress-tested into elite schools and colleges, and pushed to the brink of suicide or breakdown. Their highly educated mothers and fathers are putting in long hours in their chosen professions: money-rich, perhaps, but time-poor.

title: Touch of Evil
description: WASHINGTON  Forget it, America. Its Chinatown.

title: Rudy Giuliani Welcomes You To Eastern Europe
description: The message of much of Kremlin propaganda is not to showcase Russia as a beacon of progress, but to prove that Western politics is just as rotten as President Vladimir Putins. We may have corruption, the argument goes, but so does the West; our democracy is rigged, but so is theirs.

title: When Trump Gets His Alligator
description: If Watergate became, for Richard Nixon, a cancer on his presidency, then Donald Trumps Ukraine scandal is shaping up as something different: Its an alligator in his White House.

title: How to Sell Your Soul to Donald Trump
description: Theres no way that Mike Pompeo actually venerates Donald Trump. I doubt he even likes the president much.

title: Watch Out, America  The Supreme Court Is Back in Session
description: On Monday, the Supreme Court will begin hearing cases in its first complete term since the retirement of Justice Anthony Kennedy, and the confirmation of Justice Brett Kavanaugh, gave the court a newly emboldened right-wing majority.

title: Pompeo Defends Trumps Ukraine Conspiracy Theory
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo defiantly insisted on Saturday in Greece that the Trump administration was right to ask Ukrainian officials to investigate claims of election interference in the 2016 American presidential campaign, bolstering a widely debunked conspiracy theory that had already been dismissed by his own diplomatic envoy.

title: Kurt Volker, Ukraine and a Turbulent End in the Trump Administration
description: WASHINGTON  Please dont publish this letter, Kurt D. Volker, a former career foreign service officer, pleaded in 2016 with Eliot A. Cohen and Eric Edelman, two former Republican officials leading a Never Trump letter-writing movement.

title: In Paris Knife Attack, Police Ask How They Missed a Killer in Their Midst
description: PARIS  Evidence that the Paris police department missed warning signs about an employee who slashed four colleagues to death at its headquarters on Thursday is prompting demands for a leadership shake-up.

title: Woman Consumed by Columbine and Oklahoma City Killings Had 24 Pipe Bombs, Police Say
description: A Florida woman obsessed with the Columbine High School massacre and the Oklahoma City bombing was arrested after her parents discovered two dozen pipe bombs in her bedroom, the authorities said on Friday.

title: Hard Times Have Pakistani Hindus Looking to India, Where Some Find Only Disappointment
description: JODHPUR, India  By the time an angry Muslim mob stormed the local Hindu school and ransacked an adjacent temple a few weeks ago, many members of Pakistans dwindling Hindu minority had already been wondering whether it was worth trying to stay in a country where they felt increasingly unsafe.

title: Texas Stays Execution of Jewish Man After Judge Is Accused of Anti-Semitism
description: For more than 15 years on death row, Randy Halprin filed challenge after challenge to his sentence. The denials began to stack up.

title: A.L.D.S. Game 2: How the Yankees Beat the Twins
description: From 2016 to 2018, Didi Gregorius was a cornerstone for the Yankees. He played slick defense at his demanding shortstop position, improved his plate discipline and smashed at least 20 home runs each year, a crucial left-handed counterbalance in a Yankees lineup heavy on right-handers.

title: First All-Female Spacewalk Is Back On, NASA Says
description: The first spacewalk to be conducted entirely by women is scheduled for Oct. 21, NASA announced, nearly seven months after an all-female spacewalk was canceled because two properly fitted spacesuits were not readily available.

title: U.S. Nuclear Talks With North Korea Break Down in Hours
description: The first negotiations in eight months between the Trump administration and North Korea aimed at breaking the logjam over dismantling the Norths nuclear program broke down only hours after they began in Stockholm on Saturday, the North Koreans said.

title: Initial Public Offerings
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  All work and no play makes a crossword columnist punchy and weird, and Im about to go on my first real vacation this year, so if you are here because you are looking for something sub rosa and complex about this very gorgeously engineered Barkin/Barocas grid, well, come sit by me. I spent the good part of a sunny weekend afternoon trying to connect all the dots, and now I think I might have lost my mind completely.

title: Top Biden Donors Gather Amid Storm Clouds Over Campaign
description: PHILADELPHIA  Leading donors for Joseph R. Biden Jr. convened this weekend for their first donor retreat since he announced his candidacy and struck a determined posture as Mr. Bidens campaign found itself under assault from President Trump, losing its clear front-runner status and lapped in the money chase by multiple Democratic rivals, most notably Senator Elizabeth Warren.

title: Mar-a-Lago Wont Host Anti-Muslim Groups Gala, Trump Organization Says
description: An anti-Muslim organization had planned to host its annual gala next month at Mar-a-Lago, President Trumps private club in Palm Beach, Fla., before an apparent reversal on Sunday, a day after news reports appeared about the event.

title: Universal Resort Costumed Character Made White Supremacy Sign, Family Says
description: Meeting the costumed characters of the animated movie franchise Despicable Me could have been a highlight of a familys visit to Universal Orlando Resort.

title: Quotation of the Day: Tango: Passionate, Slinky, Sexist. And Changing.
description: Tango is a reflection of what is happening in our culture, and for a long time our culture has allowed men to touch you when they want to and if you complain youre dismissed as crazy.

title: Corrections: October 6, 2019
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: Calli Higgins, Lucas Hafeli
description: Calli Erin Higgins and Lucas Paul Hafeli were married Oct. 4 at Race and Religious, an events space in New Orleans. Ashleigh Ide, who became a Universal Life Minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Ashley Puscas, Gregory Hildebrand
description: Ashley Kathryn Puscas and Gregory Ryan Hildebrand were married Oct. 5 in Killington, Vt. Canon Lee Alison Crawford performed the ceremony at the Church of Our Saviour, where she is the vicar, with Victor E. Puscas Jr., an uncle of the bride who is a Roman Catholic deacon, taking part.

title: Carly Daitch, Andrew Lemchen
description: Carly Eve Daitch and Dr. Andrew Taylor Lemchen were married Oct. 5 at Granite Links, a golf club and events space in Quincy, Mass. Cantor Hollis Schachner officiated with Rabbi Andy Vogel taking part.

title: Alice Rha, Robert Ames
description: Alice Desdemona Rha and Robert Landau Ames were married Oct. 5 in Manhattan. Lily S. Axelrod, a friend of the couple who was ordained through American Marriage Ministries for this event, officiated at the Harvard Club of New York City.

title: McKell Forbes, Enrique Lopez Salazar
description: McKell Lyn Forbes and Enrique Xavier Lopez Salazar were married Oct. 4. David O. Sutton performed the sealing ceremony and officiated at the Hartford Connecticut Temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in Farmington, Conn.

title: Heidi Howland, Cameron Akbari
description: Heidi Lauri Howland and Dr. Cameron Akbari were married Oct. 5 at the Mayflower Inn in Washington, Conn. The Rev. Melinda Keck, a retired minister of the First Congregational Church of Kent in Kent, Conn., officiated

title: Natalie Cappello, Robert Agresta
description: Natalie Marie Cappello and Robert Anthony Agresta were married Oct. 4 at Chiesa di San Lorenzo in Lombardy, Italy. The Rev. Luca Giansante, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Grace Eubank, Ryan Beck
description: Grace Harriette Eubank and Ryan Joseph Beck were married Oct. 4 in Brooklyn. Ahri Findling, a friend of the couple ordained by the American Marriage Ministries, officiated at the Picnic House in Prospect Park.

title: Christa Heavey, Timothy Yeskoo
description: Christa Colleen Heavey and Timothy Wolf Yeskoo were married Oct. 5 at the Lake Placid Club, a resort and golf club in Lake Placid, N.Y. The Rev. Laurin C. McArthur, a Presbyterian minister, officiated, with Dmitriy V. Burdzhalov, a friend of the couple, taking part in the ceremony.

title: Hannah Ferenchick, Rohan Policherla
description: Dr. Hannah Ruth Baker Ferenchick and Dr. Rohan Krishna Policherla were married Oct. 5 at the Westin Book Cadillac hotel in Detroit. Richard C. Preston, a Universal Life minister, officiated. Later that day, at the hotel, the couple took part in a ceremony incorporating Hindu wedding traditions, led by Purohit Achary, a Hindu priest.

title: Patrick Roberts, Jose Del Real
description: Patrick Soren Roberts and Jose A. Del Real were married Sept. 30 in Leidig Meadow at Yosemite National Park in California. Autrey Nassar, a Universal Life minister, officiated on the banks of the Merced River in Yosemite Valley.

title: Melanie DeFiore, Jeremy Gibbs
description: Melanie Elise DeFiore and Jeremy Cramer Gibbs were married Oct. 5 at Second, an events space in Manhattan. Cantor Nancy Bach officiated.

title: Tony Frouge, Brian Streater
description: Tony Michael Frouge and Brian Douglas Streater were married Oct. 5 at the Hoxton, Williamsburg, a hotel in Brooklyn. Judge Deborah A. Batts of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York officiated.

title: Katherine Cunningham, Mark Rutledge
description: Katherine Marie Cunningham and Mark Anthony Rutledge were married Oct. 4 at the Garrison, an events space in Garrison, N.Y. The Rev. David F. Telfort, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Johanna Paine, Andrew Buchan
description: Johanna Adams Paine and Dr. Andrew John Buchan were married Oct. 5. Maureen Abi Ghanem, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life Minister for the occasion, officiated at the home of the grooms parents in Sharon, Conn.

title: Rebecca Tanenbaum, William Lacey IV
description: Rebecca Jonas Tanenbaum and William Henry Lacey IV were married Oct. 5 at the Gibbes Museum of Art in Charleston, S.C. Judge Loretta A. Preska of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York officiated.

title: Anna Meacham, Said Nashashibi
description: Anna Weedon Meacham and Said Labib Nashashibi were married Oct. 5 at the Museum of the City of New York. Adani Illo Almoustapha, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated.

title: Caitlin OToole, Hazel Payne
description: Caitlin OToole and Hazel Ann Payne were married Oct. 5 in Jefferson Market Garden in New York. Suanne Bonan, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Mark Munro, Chirag Chotalia
description: Mark Stanford Munro and Chirag Rajesh Chotalia were married Oct. 5 at a private residence in Marfa, Texas. Geetanjali Dhillion, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Jessica DiRocco, Rocco Sainato
description: Jessica Susan DiRocco and Rocco Michael Sainato were married Sept. 30 at Brooklyn Borough Hall. Huiling Zheng, a staff member of the city clerks office, officiated. On Oct. 5, Jake D. Bertanza, a friend of the couple, led them in a ceremony that included an exchange of vows and rings in an events space at Grouse Mountain Resorts in North Vancouver, British Columbia.

title: Witness in Amber Guygers Trial Is Fatally Shot, Lawyer Says
description: A witness who delivered key testimony in the trial of Amber Guyger  the white former Dallas police officer convicted this past week in the murder of an unarmed black man, Botham Jean  was fatally shot on Friday night, a lawyer for Mr. Jeans family said.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Mr. Robot and Peaky Blinders
description: MR. ROBOT 10 p.m. on USA. After tanking the worlds economy, and then attempting to undo that hack with a bit of code, Elliot Alderson (Rami Malek) has set his sights on taking down Whiterose, the shadowy leader of the Dark Army who has been manipulating him and his gang of vigilantes for her own gain. At the end of Season 3, characters who thought they were smashing capitalism, winning back their family, bringing back their dead parent or fighting the good fight against cyberterrorism, learned that they were essentially pawns being pushed around a chessboard, Jeremy Egner wrote in his finale recap for The New York Times. Armed with that information, and a hunger for retribution, the hooded hacker will reunite with his other half, Mr. Robot, working in tandem to destroy the top one percent of the top one percent.

title: Saturday Night Live: Matthew Broderick Joins the Trump Team
description: Given time, Saturday Night Live will eventually find a celebrity impersonator to play every member of the Trump administration. This weekend, S.N.L. spun its wheel of fortune (a.k.a. Lorne Michaelss Rolodex) and landed on Matthew Broderick, who appeared as Secretary of State Mike Pompeo in a sketch about the White Houses ongoing response to the Ukraine affair and the impeachment inquiry into President Trump.

title: I Sat and Sketched Matisses Sculpture of a Woman Named Jeannette

title: Extinction Rebellion Takes Aim at Fashion
description: LONDON  Last month, on the final day of London Fashion Week, hundreds of black-clad demonstrators gathered in Trafalgar Square to embark on what they called a funeral march for fashion.

title: Hong Kong Rallies Turn Violent After Thousands Defy Face Mask Ban
description: HONG KONG  A jittery Hong Kong was again engulfed by clashes between protesters and the police on Sunday, hours after tens of thousands of people marched in a largely peaceful show of force against a contentious ban on face masks.

title: The Amazon Is Still Burning. Blame Beef.
description: Welcome to the lawless heart of the Brazilian Amazon. Here, cattle ranchers and loggers  emboldened by President Jair Bolsonaro  are clearing and burning huge swaths of rainforest every day in the name of progress.

title: Threats and Promises in Brazils Lawless Amazon
description: NOVO PROGRESSO, BRAZIL  In early August, Adecio Piran wrote an article for this Amazon towns news website announcing a Day of Fire, to be started on August 10. The post suggested a coordinated criminal effort among local landowners and cattle ranchers to burn newly cleared rainforest  much of it on public land. The unnamed organizers of the collective action, Mr. Piran wrote, wanted to draw the attention of President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: The Phones Are Alive, With the Sounds of Katie Couric
description: EAST HAMPTON, N.Y.  Beyond a thicket of dahlias, Katie Couric climbed through a tangle of vines to pick a squat little eggplant. Each week during the summer in this beach hamlet, she takes inventory of her vegetable garden, and on a mid-September Saturday, the patch of soil was bursting with shishitos, jalapeos, and cherry tomatoes.

title: The Week in Books
description: We take the weekend to highlight recent books coverage:

title: Slop It On!: Unicorn Spit Beguiles the Etsy Crowd
description: BONNER SPRINGS, Kan.  Theres no such thing as perfect, said Michelle Nicole, wearing a light-up unicorn headband and standing behind a white table with rainbow-colored balloons arching above her. On a balmy morning not long ago, in an art studio about 10 minutes outside Kansas City, 120 attendees from as far away as Canada were gathered. They had each snagged a ticket to the second annual Unicorn Spit Extravaganza.

title: Italys Connection to the Russia Investigation, Explained
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General William P. Barr has said he is reviewing the origins of the Russia investigation. As part of the review, Mr. Barr met recently with officials in Italy, where in 2016 a Trump campaign adviser met Joseph Mifsud, a professor whose actions figured prominently into the F.B.I.s rationale for opening the Russia inquiry.

title: Barr and a Top Prosecutor Cast a Wide Net in Reviewing the Russia Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  After a jet carrying Attorney General William P. Barr touched down in Rome last month, some diplomats and intelligence officials at the American Embassy were unsure why he had come. They were later surprised, two officials said, to discover that he had circumvented protocols in arranging the trip, where he met with Italian political and intelligence officials.

title: Why This Ex-Con Mayor Is Running Away From Reporters
description: [Read the election results from Bridgeport and elsewhere.]

description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: Elizabeth Warrens Big Challenge: Winning Black Voters
description: ROCK HILL, S.C.  For her most recent rally in South Carolina, Senator Elizabeth Warren chose Clinton College, a historically black institution in this racially diverse city. Her campaign handed out signs reading, African Americans With Warren. And in smaller print: Black issues are American issues.

title: Traveling to the Rhythm of Cuba, and Trying to Keep Up
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Portugal Prime Minister Is Re-Elected as Socialists Solidify Position
description: LISBON  Prime Minister Antnio Costa of Portugal won Sundays national election, as voters rewarded his Socialist party for returning the country to robust growth and budgetary health.

title: Philippine Leader Rodrigo Duterte Says He Has Neuromuscular Disease
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has revealed that he has a neuromuscular disease that has led to a slew of medical problems, including making his eye droop.

title: As the Supreme Court Gets Back to Work, Five Big Cases to Watch
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court returns to the bench on Monday to start a term that will be studded with major cases on gay and transgender rights, immigration, abortion, guns and religion. The rulings will arrive by June, in the midst of an already divisive presidential campaign.

title: Impeachment, Supreme Court, Tango: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ginger Baker, Superstar Rock Drummer With Cream, Is Dead at 80
description: Ginger Baker, who helped redefine the role of the drums in rock and became a superstar in the process, died on Sunday in a hospital in southeastern England. He was 80.

title: The Week in Business: The Markets and Impeachment
description: Before we get started, if youre craving impeachment updates, you can get the latest with our new Impeachment Briefing newsletter. Weve got more on the economic impact below plus news on a victory for college athletes and what to expect from a new term for the Supreme Court.

title: Kansas City Shooting: 4 Killed and 5 Others Wounded at Bar
description: KANSAS CITY, Kan.  One week after he had angrily barged into a small neighborhood bar, seething and belligerent, the man returned, cursing and shouting about gangs. He threw a plastic cup at a bartender who refused to serve him, witnesses said, and fought with a customer before he was escorted out, just as he had been the week before.

title: In Hong Kongs Crackdown on Protests, Face Mask Ban May Be the Start
description: HONG KONG  When Hong Kongs leader invoked emergency powers to ban face masks during protests, she went to great lengths to explain that the city wasnt in a state of emergency. Rather, she declared, after months of unrest, the city was in a very critical state of public danger.

title: The Twist in a Yankees-Astros A.L.C.S. Rematch? Houston Is Even Better This Time
description: HOUSTON  The favorites are wasting no time, eager to get on with it already.

title: 6 Elephants Die After Plunging Over a Waterfall in Thailand
description: Six wild elephants fell over a treacherous waterfall in Thailand and died after one of the herd, a 3-year-old, was swept away by the river and the others tried to save it, national park officials said on Sunday.

title: Addicted to Screens? Thats Really a You Problem
description: Nir Eyal does not for a second regret writing Silicon Valleys tech engagement how-to, Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products, even as he now has a new book out on how to free ourselves of that same addiction.

title: North Korea Rules Out Quick Resumption of Sickening Talks with U.S.
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea said on Sunday that it had no desire to engage in sickening negotiations with the United States anymore, rejecting Washingtons suggestion that negotiators from both countries meet again in Stockholm in two weeks.

title: Jeremy Corbyn or No-Deal Brexit? The U.K. Might Have to Choose
description: LONDON  He is the bane of bankers, a bearded, teetotaling socialist often derided in the British press and in Parliament for his efforts to suppress dissent inside the Labour Party and his radical plans to remake the British economy.

title: Legal Team Says It Represents a Second Whistle-Blower Over Trump and Ukraine
description: WASHINGTON  An intelligence official with firsthand knowledge has provided information related to President Trumps dealings with Ukraine and is now protected from retaliation as a whistle-blower, lawyers representing the official said on Sunday, confirming that a second individual has come forward in the matter.

title: Ginger Bakers Essential Songs: Listen to 15 Tracks
description: Ginger Baker, who died Sunday at the age of 80, was an architect of rock drumming, spilling across tom-toms with both power and nuance. His work in the 1960s with the bands Cream and Blind Faith made him a defining figure of many basic rock band concepts: the power trio, the supergroup, the drum solo, jamming, double-kick drumming and  much to his trademark chagrin  an early thruway for heavy metal.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Ill get dragged all over the farm for saying so, but sometimes I like to cook with soda pop. Ive braised ribs in Dr Pepper. I make a barbecue sauce with Coke. Lately, as I wrote for The New York Times Magazine this week, Ive been making poundcake with lemon-lime 7Up.

title: Kosovo Voters Want a New Future, but Old Problems Linger
description: Ever since Kosovo ended its war with Serbia two decades ago, most of its dominant political figures have been men who rose to prominence as fighters and held onto power despite failing to secure a lasting peace and presiding over a floundering economy.

title: Kamala Harris Has Settled on an Iowa Strategy. Now What?
