title: Should Family Members See Patients Die in the I.C.U.?
description: On one recent intensive care unit shift, I admitted a man whose heart had stopped earlier that day. By the time I met him, it seemed clear that he wasnt going to live. So when he went into cardiac arrest for what I suspected would be the last time, I headed out of the unit to find his wife.

title: A New Biography of Janis Joplin Captures the Pain and Soul of an Adventurous Life
description: Had she not died at 27 of an accidental heroin overdose, Janis Joplin would be 76  two years younger than Paul Simon and four years younger than Mavis Staples. Singers with scorched voices sometimes settle more deeply into them. (Have you heard the most recent Marianne Faithfull album?) One wonders at the body of recordings Joplin might have made.

title: 7 Combat Deployments in 6 Years, Then a Bullet Nearly Killed Him
description: When a bullet tore through Sgt. First Class Jeffery M. Dawsons torso on July 20, the Army bomb technicians seventh combat deployment in six years came to a sudden end. Dawson was already a legend in the small, tight-knit world of bomb-disposal soldiers, having received the Distinguished Service Cross  a medal ranked second only to the Medal of Honor for combat valor  for an earlier mission with Army Rangers in Afghanistan, and was scheduled to try out for the elite Delta Force in West Virginia after returning home. But now, lying on the ground, his mission that night as part of a small C.I.A. Omega Team leading Afghan commandos was over  and maybe his military career as well.

title: New French Fiction: From Farm to Table, With Feasting in Between
description: ANIMALIA

title: Considering Love, Loss and Jeanette Winterson
description: Sarah Lotz reviews Jeanette Wintersons latest novel, Frankissstein, in this weeks issue. In 1993, Jim Shepard wrote for the Book Review about Written on the Body, Wintersons novel about an affair between the narrator (whose name and gender are never specified) and a married woman..

title: How Can People Be Persuaded to Eat Less Meat?
description: To the Editor:

title: New in Paperback: The Browns of California and The Far Field.
description: THE BROWNS OF CALIFORNIA: The Family Dynasty that Transformed a State and Shaped a Nation, by Miriam Pawel. (Bloomsbury, $20.) Pawel traces four generations of the Brown family and their 24-year political domination of California, recounting the two-term governorships of Edmund (Pat) Brown and his son, Edmund (Jerry) Brown Jr. Our reviewer, Lisa McGirr, found the book fascinating.

title: Are You a Worrier?
description: How much of a worrier are you? Do you generally believe things will work out? Or are you constantly thinking about what could go wrong?

title: Houses Where Friends Used to Live
description: This Halloween, my daughters will don their wigs and wands and, holding out their plastic pumpkins, knock on the doors of houses where friends used to live.

title: Oliver and Elio Are Back
description: FIND ME By Andr Aciman

title: Justin Hartley of This Is Us Meditates on His Rolexes
description: See that hand? said Justin Hartley, pointing to the second hand on his Rolex Daytona as it skimmed the black-and-champagne face. That hand is going so slow. And it never speeds up.

title: Diamond Doris, the Bourbon King and Other Stars of True Crime
description: People tend to think of crime and mystery stories as escapist literature, a way to hide from the atrocities and absurdities of real life. But crime fiction is my reality. So whenever I want some escapist entertainment, I pick up a book about an actual crime. Lucky for me, people can be reliably wicked, so there are always plenty of these true-crime chronicles of violence, madness and appalling misbehavior.

title: The Miraculous Revival of the Last Fire Watchtower (Built in 1856)
description: Four years ago things were not looking good for the Harlem fire watchtower.

title: The Talented Patricia Highsmiths Private Diaries Are Going Public
description: No writer would ever betray his secret life, the novelist Patricia Highsmith wrote to a friend in 1940. It would be like standing naked in public.

title: Who Is Don McGahn, the Lawyer Behind Trumps Court Makeover?
description: Most Americans may not know Donald F. McGahn IIs name, but theyll likely live with his legacy for decades to come.

title: The C.E.O. Taking On the Gun Lobby
description: Ed Stack didnt set out to be an activist.

title: A Dutch Golden Age? Thats Only Half the Story
description: AMSTERDAM  Elisabeth Samson, an 18th-century freeborn black woman, made millions as a coffee planter and exporter using slave labor in the Dutch colony of Suriname. She was one of the wealthiest women of the era, but few people have ever heard her story.

title: Pentagon, With an Eye on China, Pushes for Help From American Tech
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Pentagon officials have been holding private discussions with tech industry executives to wrestle with a key question: how to ensure future supplies of the advanced computer chips needed to retain Americas military edge.

title: Alyssa Milano, Celebrity Activist for the Celebrity Presidential Age
description: WASHINGTON  Alyssa Milano was on Capitol Hill in a floral dress and black Dr. Martens combat boots, her hair pulled into a tight bun atop her head. This is the look  the bun and the boots  that her best friend, Alaa Khaled, says signals to him that were in for something.

title: George Soros Has Enemies. Hes Fine With That.
description: George Soros is a billionaire philanthropist, a former currency trader, a liberal champion and in certain circles a boogeyman. That last label seems to be a badge of honor.

title: Can a Restored Pompeii Be Saved From Clambering Tourists?
description: Its easy to imagine lounging in the garden at the sprawling villa of Julia Felix, a savvy Roman business woman who lived in the ancient Roman city of Pompeii in the first century A.D. There would have been wine to drink, and fresh figs, apricots and walnuts to savor. The warm sea breeze would have blended the dry scent of cypress and bay leaves with the stench of rubbish and excrement from the street, and the gurgle of water in the baths would have been occasionally drowned out by cries from the crowd in the 20,000-seat amphitheater nearby.

title: Jenny Slate Wrote a Book-Shaped Thing. What Is It?
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass.  The only piece of fiction in Jenny Slates new book, Little Weirds, describes a love that grew old in an un-air-conditioned house by the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Scientists Were Hunting for the Next Ebola. Now the U.S. Has Cut Off Their Funding.
description: In a move that worries many public health experts, the federal government is quietly shutting down a surveillance program for dangerous animal viruses that someday may infect humans.

title: For Impeachment Witnesses, Testifying Can Cost $15,000 or More
description: WASHINGTON  As a parade of State Department officials began trooping to Capitol Hill this month to testify in the impeachment inquiry imperiling President Trump, officials from the departments employee association dispatched an appeal to its nearly 17,000 members.

title: Are the Suburbs Turning Democratic?
description: EAST GRAND RAPIDS, Mich.  Dave Levitt became a Republican after getting his M.B.A. in 1990. Like him, Republicans valued fiscal conservatism, balanced budgets and free trade, all the things you learn in business school that are good and help people, Mr. Levitt said.

title: In Mexico City, a Blossoming of All Things Japanese
description: On a summer afternoon  in Mexico Citys leafy Roma Norte neighborhood, a steady stream of customers filled the tiny coffee shop Raku, which means joy in Japanese. While they were drawn by the coffee, I was in the new spot to learn how the owner Mauricio Zubirats makes a cup of matcha tea.

title: How The Astro Poets Spend Their Sundays
description: The poets Alex Dimitrov and Dorothea Lasky met at a party in Brooklyn nearly a decade ago and bonded over astrology. Mr. Dimitrov, 34, a Sagittarius, and Ms. Lasky, 41, an Aries, went on to develop the Twitter account, Astro Poets. Now over half a million followers receive their weekly forecast and daily quips.

title: Using Virtual Reality to Plan Your Actual Retirement
description: Picture this: You are in the country, on a trip through a pleasantly green, rolling landscape dotted with trees. It has a slightly dreamlike quality.

title: The Mets Herculean Task: 4 Operas in 48 Hours
description: It was Friday afternoon, five hours before curtain, and a stylized Japan was taking shape on the stage of the Metropolitan Opera. A crew was untangling ropes of cherry blossoms to form the backdrop of Madama Butterflys house in Nagasaki.

title: Carriage Houses in Clinton Hill
description: Stables and garages along Waverly Avenue have seen a variety of uses over the years.

title: The Many Lives of a Carriage House
description: When Lisa Radcliffe bought a tumbledown, neo-Georgian-style garage in the Clinton Hill section of Brooklyn in 1999, she made an intriguing discovery. The interior of the original structure, built in 1916 to house three cars for a chocolate magnate, was unadorned, its ground-floor walls lined with glazed white brick.

title: The American Dream Mall, Wegmans and Nordstrom Finally Open
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Botswana Election Won by President, Despite Rift with Predecessor
description: JOHANNESBURG  Voters in Botswana re-elected a president who had received international attention for lifting a ban on hunting elephants and overseeing the decriminalization of homosexuality.

title: All of Them Are Thieves: Iraqis Defy Security Forces to Protest Corruption
description: BAGHDAD   Rebuking their prime minister, Iraqi protesters demanding jobs and official accountability defied security forces Friday to throng central Baghdad and other cities, confronting the government with perhaps its biggest challenge since the chaotic aftermath of the American invasion that toppled Saddam Hussein 16 years ago.

title: California, Tulsi Gabbard, Betsy DeVos: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Its Not Easy Being Evil
description: To maintain your status as a Dark Lord of the Seven Sisters, you have to submit sufficient evidence of dastardly deeds to the Council of Evil Overlords. Those include poisonings, unfortunate transfiguration, a racket (tennis equipment not acceptable), murder, kidnappings, plague and/or enhanced weather phenomena. In Sarah Jean Horwitzs THE DARK LORD CLEMENTINE (Algonquin, 329 pp., $17.99; ages 10 and up), a hilariously heartwarming magical adventure, thats not as easy as it sounds.

title: Two Parts of a Quantum Entanglement
description: Marissa Maier, who grew up in a TriBeCa loft in the early 90s, didnt have a regular bedtime or even a regular wardrobe. She mostly wore costumes. Her mother, Kathleen Russo, was a talent agent for dancers, actors and writers, and there were always theatrical people coming over for dinner or putting on impromptu performances.

title: Facebook Calls Truce With Publishers as It Unveils Facebook News
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Facebook and the publishing industry have long been frenemies: Occasionally they teamed up, but mostly they competed.

title: Those College Students Who Used the N-Word Shouldnt Have Been Arrested
description: Imagine if the cast members of The Book of Mormon could be arrested and prosecuted for ridiculing Mormons. Preposterous, you say?

title: The Original Dolemite Is Bad, Very Bad. But It Matters.
description: This article includes minor spoilers for Dolemite Is My Name.

title: A Prophet: The Zeal of Bernie Sanders Supporters
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Donald Trumps Lynching
description: Donald Trump is reckless with words and careless with actions. Theres no evidence that he thinks deeply about anything. Which is why I was not shocked when he condemned the House impeachment inquiry as a lynching earlier this week.

title: Why Doesnt Mark Zuckerberg Get It?
description: If Facebook were a religion, it would be the worlds largest faith, with just under a third of the planet, 2.4 billion people, tied into a network controlled largely by one man. Its a business, of course, with a business model that makes much of its money by channeling tidings of sludge around, often to great harm.

title: Let the Viejos Play: In the World Series, Age Is an Asset
description: HOUSTON  There is a nickname that the more experienced players on the Washington Nationals use to describe themselves: Los Viejos. In Spanish, it means the Old Ones.

title: George Soros Says Wall Street Wont Decide the 2020 Election
description: Good Friday. This years DealBook Summit will feature speakers like Bill Gates, Hillary Clinton, the Obama administration adviser Valerie Jarrett and Brian Chesky of Airbnb. Apply to attend here. (Was this email forwarded to you? Sign up here.)

title: In a Quiet Corner, an Old Afghan Poet Polishes the Hearts Mirror
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  For more than 50 years now, a mystic poet has kept a quiet window desk at the Kabul Public Library. His seat overlooks the hustle and bustle of the Afghan capital city, all but unrecognizable from the day he arrived as a young library clerk  one with a dreamy mind and stammering speech, but fine calligraphic handwriting that helped land him his day job.

title: For the Warriors, New Arena, New Players and a Shaky New Start
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The prevailing feeling has been one of newness for the Golden State Warriors. New season. New arena. New city. And even a new roster, or at least one that has undergone a significant makeover since the team stuffed its championship banners into moving vans and made its way across the Bay Bridge from Oakland a few months ago.

title: Maleficent: Mistress of Evil | Anatomy of a Scene
description: The director Joachim Ronning narrates a sequence from his film.

title: Which Kind of Witch Should She Be?
description: Moth Hush, the protagonist of Emma Steinkellners THE OKAY WITCH (Aladdin, 272 pp., $20.99; ages 10 and up), is a typical 13-year-old girl living with her single mother in the fictional town of Founders Bluff, Mass. During a Halloween-themed lesson at school, Moth (dressed in a witch costume, naturally) learns the history of the Founders Bluff Witch Hunt, a centuries-old Salem-like event that pitted the towns founding settlers against outsiders thought to possess evil magic. The knowledge triggers something deep within Moth, and she starts to experience supernatural powers beyond her control. When bullies come for her after class she is able to take their voices away. Frightened, she turns to her mother, who reveals the secret shes kept from Moth her entire life: They are really a family of witches. And not just that, they are descendants of the very witches driven out of Founders Bluff.

title: How Angelina Jolie Casts a Spell in Maleficent: Mistress of Evil
description: In Anatomy of a Scene, we ask directors to reveal the secrets that go into making key scenes in their movies. See new episodes in the series each Friday. You can also watch our collection of more than 150 videos on YouTube and subscribe to our YouTube channel.

title: Chinas Response to Pence Speech: Sheer Arrogance
description: BEIJING  After Vice President Mike Pence excoriated China and American companies that he accused of selling out their principles to do business there, a sharp response from Beijing was to be expected. But perhaps not this sharp.

title: Elijah Cummingss Funeral Draws Presidents and Thousands of Mourners
description: BALTIMORE  Two former United States presidents and a throng of powerful American leaders joined thousands of everyday people in Baltimore on Friday to bid farewell to Representative Elijah E. Cummings, a towering African-American presence in Washington who was praised for his integrity, his character and, in his final months, his unwavering challenges to President Trump.

title: The Week in Arts: Sleater-Kinney, Paul Taylor and Synonyms
description: Oct. 30-31; ticketmaster.com.

title: Mystery of 39 Bodies in Truck Leads to More Arrests in U.K.
description: LONDON  Two more men and a woman were arrested on suspicion of conspiracy to traffic people and manslaughter after 39 people were found dead in a refrigerated trailer in southeastern England, the British police said on Friday, the first indication from officials that the deaths were linked to human smuggling.

title: Congratulations, Mr. President
description: This article is part of David Leonhardts newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it each weekday.

title: A Bigger Role for Women in the Catholic Church? 185 Men Will Decide
description: ROME  The Vaticans extraordinary three-week meeting of bishops from the Amazon region, which ends this weekend, has generated intense debate within the church over the possibility of ordaining older, married men in remote areas.

title: Even in Strong Economy, Most Families Dont Have Enough Emergency Savings
description: Six weeks of take-home pay.

title: The Week in Tech: Googles Quantum Leap
description: Each week, we review the weeks news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Ronald Feldman, Risk-taking Gallerist, Retires After Nearly 50 Years
description: Ronald Feldman, the pioneering contemporary art dealer, has stepped down from his role of director at the Ronald Feldman Gallery after nearly 50 years at the helm, for health reasons.

title: N.F.L. Week 8 Predictions: Our Picks Against the Spread
description: Drew Brees is likely to come back for New Orleans after five weeks away but Patrick Mahomes needs at least one week to recover after dislocating his kneecap in Week 7. The Packers and the Saints  with Brees or without him  will look to continue their hot streaks, while the Patriots and the 49ers will try to stay undefeated. And dont forget about the Bills, whose defense has them 5-1, with their only loss coming against New England.

title: A Cabin With a Literary Pedigree
description: MILFORD, Pa.  Charlie Chaplin slept here. So did Sarah Bernhardt, Mary Pickford, Lillian Gish, Franz Liszt, Warren Harding, Andrew Carnegie, Thomas Wolfe, Cloris Leachman and Arlene Dahl. Likewise, D.W. Griffith, who, in 1912, shot two movies  A Feud in the Kentucky Hills and The Informer  in this dot of a town in the foothills of the Poconos.

title: A Twin Threat as Fires Burn Across California
description: Good morning.

title: Lucy Liu, Tyler Cameron and Jennifer Hudson on the Gala Circuit
description: Benefits were held for Hudson River Park, Harlem School of the Arts and the Alzheimers Association.

title: Galas Galore
description: The fall social season is in full swing: A dozen high-profile benefits took place on Monday night alone. Hudson River Park held a fund-raiser dinner on Oct. 17 at Cipriani South Street. Harlem School of the Arts held a mask ball on Oct. 21 at the Plaza. And Jennifer Hudson performed at the Alzheimers Association gala at the Rainbow Room on Oct. 22.

title: Elijah Cummings Is Remembered as a Great Man, a Moral Leader and a Friend
description: At the funeral for Representative Elijah E. Cummings, former president Barack Obama and former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton were among the prominent politicians who spoke.

title: This Is Who Weve Been Waiting For: A Diva on the Precipice
description: LONDON  Julia Bullock had a cold.

title: Moonlight Unlocked the Door. Naomie Harris Charged Through It.
description: Naomie Harris often says her breakout role was in the 2003 post-apocalyptic thriller 28 Days Later with Cillian Murphy, but that is not exactly true.

title: What Generations of Gay Men Hand Down in The Inheritance
description: I cant imagine what those years were like, says a young gay man named Eric, contemplating the worst of the AIDS crisis. I can understand what it was. But I cannot possibly feel what it was.

title: Pete Buttigieg Is Running Strong in Iowa. Does He Have Room to Grow?
description: Welcome to Poll Watch, our weekly look at polling data and survey research on the candidates, voters and issues that will shape the 2020 election.

title: G.M. Workers Approve Contract and End U.A.W. Strike
description: The longest nationwide strike against General Motors in half a century ended on Friday after a solid majority of the companys union members delivered their support for the four-year contract hammered out by their leaders.

title: Indonesian Report on Lion Air Crash Finds Numerous Problems
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The first officer told the captain that he had been called at 4 a.m. and told to work the flight, which was not on his original schedule. The captain replied that he had the flu. He coughed 15 times in the hour before takeoff.

title: Desserts Over Darkness
description: Good morning. Diwali, the Indian festival of lights, is celebrated on Sunday. Technically a Hindu celebration of the triumph of good over evil, it is has become something of a cultural event in America, as Priya Krishna reported in The Times this week. Its a symbolic holiday that unites us as a diaspora, Representative Raja Krishnamoorthi, Democrat of Illinois, told her.

title: The Weird World of Haunted eBay: Purchase With Caution
description: An artists obsession with listings for the cursed, doomed and otherwise unexplained.

title: December Democratic Debate Will Be in Los Angeles, With Higher Thresholds
description: The Democratic National Committee announced on Friday that the sixth Democratic primary debate would be held in December at the University of California, Los Angeles, while ratcheting up the polling and donor criteria for candidates to qualify for a coveted spot onstage.

title: California Fires Update: Thousands Evacuated; Governor Declares State of Emergency
description: SANTA CLARITA, Calif.  A fire that forced the evacuation of 50,000 people spread through canyons north of Los Angeles on Friday, jumping a freeway and threatening thousands of homes.

title: Trouble in Paradise: Chiles Inequality Explodes
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  In the past week Chile has been gripped by a wave of fury and indignation. Chileans of all ages have poured into the streets armed with kitchenware, banging pots to demand reforms  Latin Americas traditional cacerolazo form of protest. Demonstrations have been both violent and peaceful, leading the government to declare a curfew in some parts of the country and a state of emergency. Troops have been deployed to restore order for the first time since Chile returned to democracy 30 years ago. At least 18 people have died so far and thousands have been arrested. The illusion of Chile as an oasis in a convulsed region has cracked.

title: Making Mrs. Fletcher: Arguing. Futzing. Spanking. Agreeing.
description: Porn is a complex cultural force, a tool of exploitation, degradation and perhaps self-discovery that, in our age of constant connectivity, is rarely more than a few clicks away.

title: A Pancake Thats Ready for All the Vegetables in Your Fridge
description: Pajeon, those crisp-edged, scallion-filled Korean pancakes, are delectable in any weather. But its on rainy, blustery days, when the skies seem bleak and the air feels damp, that the chef Sohui Kim craves them the most.

title: Your Uber Driver Is Retired? You Shouldnt Be Surprised
description: Dave Zarrow, who lives in Reston, Va., figures he spends about 20 hours a week in his 2017 Camry driving for Uber, the ride-hailing company.

title: 8 Years After The Night Circus, Erin Morgenstern Has a New Novel
Too Many Blowouts, Not Enough Competition
description: What was your favorite moment of the Champions League this week? Was it Paris St.-Germain putting five past Club Bruges, away from home? Maybe you were delighted by just how easily Manchester City swatted aside Atalanta, or perhaps you were enthralled by just how many goals Tottenham could score against Red Star Belgrade. It probably would not have been Liverpools win at Genk: after all, the reigning European champions only scored four. A disappointing nights work, really.

title: How Do You Impersonate Judy Garland? Ask a Drag Queen
description: Half a century after Judy Garland died and 80 years after The Wizard of Oz made her famous, she remains the rare golden-age performer whose popularity and mythology reach beyond Las Vegas and the Turner Classic Movies channel.

title: Elijah Cummings Funeral: Bill and Hillary Clinton Urge Defense of Democracy
description: Speaking at the funeral of Representative Elijah E. Cummings, former President Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton, the former secretary of state, offered a forceful defense of democracy and compared the late congressman, a leader in the impeachment inquiry into President Trump, to the prophet Elijah.

title: Imagining the World of Nazi Hunters
description: THE ACCOMPLICEBy Joseph Kanon

title: Cunning, Damaged and Deranged: The Latest Thrillers by Women
description: There has never been a more exciting or challenging time for women who write and read thrillers and crime novels. Our bodies and our actions  from the medical to the moral  are on trial every day, which can make it difficult to immerse oneself in books that touch on the further brutality of women. And yet, women crime novelists have utterly captured the genre, pushing its boundaries in important, exciting and creative ways. Writers such as Megan Abbott, Laura Lippman, Alafair Burke and Tana French, to name just a few, give us powerful female characters who upend the stereotypes of their gender. Some of them are cunning, others damaged or deranged. These characters appear on all sides of investigations as victims, investigators and even criminals, reinvigorating the genre as they break down its barriers.

title: A Sympathetic Look at Spiritualism Past and Present
description: THE IN-BETWEENSThe Spiritualists, Mediums, and Legends of Camp EtnaBy Mira Ptacin

title: Bernie Sanders Almost Won Iowa in 2016. He Knows He Cant Slip Now.
description: MARSHALLTOWN, Iowa  On a trip to Iowa in June, Senator Bernie Sanders confided in aides about a central gamble of his second bid for the White House.

title: If the Choice Is Warren or Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: In One Afghan District, the Same Promises of Victory, 32 Years Apart
description: [At War is a newsletter about the experiences and costs of war. Sign up here to get it delivered to your inbox every Friday.]

title: Why Does Only One Party Play by the Rules?
description: Its that time of the campaign season when some Democrats are starting to feel  as President Jimmy Carter might have put it  malaise. Theyre staring at their 2020 lineup and wondering whether its a guaranteed recipe for buyers remorse. Joe Biden is too old, Pete Buttigieg is too young, Kamala Harris is too uncertain, Bernie Sanders too unpalatable, Elizabeth Warren too unelectable.

title: In Criminal Justice Speech, Trump Belittles Obamas Efforts for Black People
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  President Trump, speaking to a handpicked audience of supporters at a historically black college here on Friday, belittled the Obama administrations record on racial equity and claimed that his own administration had helped African-Americans beyond anything in the history of our country.

title: U.S. to Deploy Hundreds of Troops to Guard Oil Fields in Syria, Pentagon Officials Say
description: BRUSSELS  The United States will deploy several hundred troops to guard eastern oil fields in Syria against the Islamic State, defense officials said Friday, another lurch in President Trumps zigzagging military policy in the country.

title: In the Van With the Juicers Who Round Up and Recharge Lime Scooters
description: LOS ANGELES  Michelle and Gonzalo Cabezas begin their nightly scavenger hunt at 10. Thats when they start looking for the Lime scooters that people rent and ride by the minute  and leave wherever they please.

title: How Europeans See America
description: We asked young, ordinary Europeans to take a look at U.S. policies on everything from food to guns. As they discover facts about America, theyre not impressed.

title: Maps: California Fires, Evacuation Zones and Power Outages
description: Detailed maps show the current fire extents, power outage zones and areas under evacuation orders.

title: Profit From Art Isnt Dirty. It Means: Make More Art.
description: If you are lucky enough to create art that people are willing to pay for, I have a concept to share that had an enormous impact on me: Profit equals permission.

title: A Truly Exceptional Sheet-Pan Meal
description: Hi and welcome to Five Weeknight Dishes. Some personal news: After months of languishing on a wait list, I have finally been able to join an elite bean-delivery club  elite not because membership is carefully controlled or restricted, but because, as I understand it, there are only so many spots, and pounds of beans. I cant wait for my first quarterly shipment to arrive.

title: Clinton Praises Cummings: He Stood Against Corrupt Leadership
description: In her remarks at the funeral for Representative Elijah E. Cummings, Hillary Clinton honored him as a fighter for democracy.

title: Have Passport, Cant Travel
description: Last summer, when my family arrived at Dulles International Airport for our flight to Amsterdam, I was informed by a KLM agent that I couldnt travel abroad because my passport was set to expire in four months. I already had a return ticket.

title: Marine Veteran Is Deported to El Salvador
description: A Marine Corps veteran who served in Iraq and Afghanistan was deported to El Salvador this week after several failed attempts to stay in the United States, where he had lived since he was 3 and had been convicted of several felonies, his lawyer and immigration officials said.

title: Felicity Huffman Is Released Early
description: The actress Felicity Huffman was released early on Friday from the minimum-security prison camp outside San Francisco where she had been serving her 14-day sentence in the college admissions case, according to a Bureau of Prisons spokeswoman.

title: Trumps Put Their Washington Hotel on the Market
description: WASHINGTON  It is the most visible and potent symbol of the ethics debate that has dogged President Trump as he has served simultaneously as the nations chief executive and real estate developer with a chain of luxury hotels. And now it is for sale.

title: A Brief History of the Song Cycle in Two Recitals
description: The beginnings of things can be fuzzy. But someone tends to get credit for being the first, and in the case of the song cycle, that person is Beethoven.

title: Review: The White Light Festival Opens With a Journey to the East
description: Wherever Jordi Savall wishes to travel, an audience will follow. This early-music masters fervent community of admirers is the result of both the consistently gorgeous playing of Hesprion XXI  the ensemble he conducts and plays in  and Mr. Savalls ceaseless pursuit of unfamiliar repertoire, often presented as evening-length events that draw inspiration from diverse cultures.

title: Mark Zuckerberg: Facebook Can Help the News Business
description: When reporters at The Minnesota Star Tribune discovered that infant deaths had significantly increased in the states child care facilities, they published a series of articles that ended up driving changes in the law. They won a Pulitzer Prize in 2013  and within months the infant mortality rate had dropped. As someone married to a pediatrician and committed to investing in solving health challenges, I found this to be a powerful example of how journalism can help us make progress on our biggest issues.

title: A Brexit Logjam, in Three Dimensions
description: LONDON  Prime Minister Boris Johnson says he will not do business with Parliament until the opposition Labour Party agrees to a general election. Labour says it will not agree to an election until the European Union decides how long an extension to grant Britain to leave. And European leaders say they will not make that decision until the deadlock in London is broken.

title: Marta Kurtag Dies at 92, Sundering a Profound Musical Partnership
description: Marta Kurtag, a pianist and teacher who shared a 72-year collaboration with her husband, the prominent avant-garde composer Gyorgy Kurtag, profoundly influencing his work and joining him in dual recitals that acquired a legendary reputation in their later years, died on Oct. 17 in Budapest. She was 92.

title: Review: Mark Morris Fits Houston Ballet to a V
description: Houston Ballet, in town for its 50th anniversary, lured me in with the promise of a real dance: Thats what Mark Morris makes. The Letter V, which he choreographed for the company in 2015, is better than that. Its gorgeous.

title: Maurice Nadjari Dies at 95; Crusading, and Criticized, Prosecutor
Kellyanne Conway and Newspaper Face Off Over Warning to Reporter
description: Kellyanne Conway, a counselor to President Trump and one of his fiercest defenders, found herself in a standoff on Friday with a conservative-leaning newspaper after it accused her of threatening to investigate a reporters personal life.

title: Federal Budget Deficit Swelled to Nearly $1 Trillion in 2019
description: WASHINGTON  The United States federal budget deficit jumped 26 percent in the 2019 fiscal year to $984 billion, reaching its highest level in seven years as the government was forced to borrow more money to pay for President Trumps tax and spending policies, official figures showed on Friday.

title: Maria Butina, Russian Who Infiltrated Conservative Circles, Is Deported
description: WASHINGTON  Maria Butina, the young firearms advocate and covert Russian agent who tried to infiltrate conservative Republican circles during the 2016 presidential campaign, is headed back to her home country after serving 15 months in prison for conspiring to act as a foreign agent.

title: In Tribute to Cummings, Obama Hints at Rebuke of Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Former President Barack Obama, who has remained largely silent amid the convulsive impeachment debate now gripping the nation, offered a tribute to a late Democratic congressman on Friday that sounded to some listeners like an implicit rebuke of President Trump.

title: Harold Bloom, Toni Morrison and the Canon Wars
description: To the Editor:

title: Love Letter: Like Your Friend, Hate His Husband
description: Love Letter is a weekly email about relationship highs, lows and woes. Sign up here to receive it in your inbox every Friday.

title: The Playlist: Frank Oceans Pillow Talk, and 12 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: What the California Fires Look Like, Up Close and From the Sky
description: Peak fire season is far from over in California. The Tick Fire and the Kincade Fire are among several blazes in the state, forcing thousands of evacuations.

title: Olive Kitteridge Isnt One to Brag, but Shes on the Best-Seller List
description: In the first chapter of Elizabeth Strouts Olive, Again, which debuts at No. 6 on this weeks hardcover fiction list, the man who will become Olives second husband writes, Dear Olive Kitteridge, I have missed you and if you would see fit to call me or email me or see me, I would like that very much.

title: Thar Be Witches, and Us
description: EDINBURGH  Tucked around a corner facing Edinburgh Castle is a modest memorial to accused witches, so unobtrusive that most tourists walk right past on their way to the larger attraction. Made in 1894, the Witches Well is the only such remembrance in town. A plaque shows the profiles of two women, one angry, one mild, and a snake circling them both. Beneath is a small basin that holds not water but a few flowers.

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: Welcome to the weekend. The impeachment inquiry. The wildfires in California. A quantum breakthrough by Google. I guess theres no such thing as a slow news week anymore. Here are some great stories Im sure you meant to read, so take some time and do it!

title: Los Angeles Has a New Comedy Clubhouse: Dynasty Typewriter
description: LOS ANGELES  The small triangular greenroom is typically decorated with artificial vines over a soothing woodland backdrop. Earlier this month it was also crowded with friends, agents, publicists, producers, makeup artists and hair stylists, all hovering around the stand-up Esther Povitsky.

title: Two Pianists Offer Contrasting Paths of Exploration
description: Classical music is overly beholden to traditional concert formats and standard repertory. So its important, and often exciting, for artists to be adventurous. There are different ways to do so, as two pianists demonstrated in completely contrasting programs this week in New York.

title: I Want to Be Heard: Adult Sex-Abuse Victims Demand New Rights
description: ALBANY, N.Y.  An immediate warning sign, she now realizes, should have been evident in their first conversation.

title: Trump Again Defends Rudy Giuliani
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Friday defended his personal lawyer, Rudolph W. Giuliani, who is under investigation by federal prosecutors for his dealings in Ukraine, as a great crime fighter.

title: Bill Traylors Outsider Art Veers Into the Mainstream
description: The actress Julia Louis-Dreyfus remembers her father, William Louis-Dreyfus, swearing on the phone in the 1990s as he almost got outbid on a painting by Bill Traylor, the Alabama artist born into slavery who took up drawing around age 85.

title: 5 Ballot Proposals for New York
description: The New York City Charter is essentially the citys constitution, laying out the structure and separation of powers of a municipal government that serves more than eight million people. From Oct. 26 to Nov. 5, voters in New York City can change it.

title: How to Get Rich by Buying a Franchise (Really)
description: Dan Gagne has been a plumber for three decades, but it has been years since he held a wrench.

title: My Family Cared for My Sick Aunt. Whos Caring for Us?
description: When I was 12, my mothers 32-year-old sister Emily experienced a berry-aneurysm rupture, which caused a stroke. One day she had a headache that she said felt like being hit with a two-by-four. She went on with life, and then collapsed the next week.

title: Troubled M.I.T. Media Lab Food Project Closes, for Now
description: The once-celebrated M.I.T. Media Lab micro-greenhouses were supposed to grow food under virtually any conditions. In the end, they worked under almost none. And now, M.I.T. has turned off the lights, possibly for good.

title: They Know What You Watched Last Night
description: A spate of streaming services are on their way from major tech and entertainment companies, promising viewers a trove of binge-worthy new shows and movies.

title: New Video Shows That Fresno Officer Shot Teen as He Fled
description: FRESNO, Calif.  New video footage shows the final moments before a Fresno police officer shot and killed an unarmed teenage boy whom the police had been trying to question about a homicide, raising concerns about whether lethal force was justified.

title: Government Watchdogs Demand Justice Dept. Withdraw Whistle-Blower Ruling
description: WASHINGTON  The governments inspectors general sharply criticized a Justice Department ruling from last month that determined that the whistle-blower complaint about President Trumps call with Ukraines leader should not go to Congress.

title: Impeachment Inquiry Is Legal, Judge Rules, Giving Democrats a Victory
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge handed a victory to House Democrats on Friday when she ruled that they were legally engaged in an impeachment inquiry, a decision that undercut President Trumps arguments that the investigation is a sham.

title: Ellen DeGeneres Just Bought a Vintage Rolex. It Only Cost Around $750,000.
description: In the vintage watch market, few timepieces are more coveted than a late-1960s gold Rolex Daytona. So how much was obtaining one worth to Ellen DeGeneres, the watch-collecting chat show host and comedian?

title: Alber Elbaz Opens Up on Plans for His New Fashion Brand
description: Alber Elbaz is ready for his comeback.

title: Russian Conscript Kills 8 Soldiers in Shooting in Siberia
67 Killed in Ethiopia Unrest, but Nobel-Winning Prime Minister Is Quiet
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  Weeks after receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed is coming under harsh criticism over his silence in the face of protests this week that police said had resulted in the deaths of 67 people.

title: Timothy Egan Makes Room for the Holy Spirit
description: A PILGRIMAGE TO ETERNITYFrom Canterbury to Rome in Search of a FaithBy Timothy Egan

title: In Canadas North, Art Emerges In the Face of Difficulty
description: Hi, this is Catherine Porter and I am filling in for Ian Austen.

title: The Long, Complicated Road to Nationals Fever
description: So, what do you do when your hometown baseball team goes to the World Series for the first time since 1933?

title: Kanye West Releases His Gospel-Themed Album Jesus Is King
description: For some artists, a blown deadline is a problem. For Kanye West, it is a marketing opportunity.

title: My Grandchild Is Not a Terrorist
description: This week, Melbourne-based reporter Livia Albeck-Ripka worked with producer Lynsea Garrison to make a two-part series about the relatives of ISIS fighters. You heard the story of Kamalle Dabboussy, whose daughter and grandchildren are detained in Syria. But there are many others. We asked Livia to tell us about her experience meeting these family members:

title: Astros Hold Off Nationals to Win Game 3 of the World Series
description: WASHINGTON  In baseball, as in many team sports, plane rides are so much more than transportation. They can be critical incubators for things like team bonding and strategy sessions, where players can work through important issues.

title: Hear Them Roar
description: I USED TO BE CHARMINGThe Rest of Eve BabitzEdited by Sara J. Kramer

title: John Lithgow on His Satirical Poems
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music | How to Listen

title: Applications Open for the 2020 New York Portfolio Review
description: We are again bringing together 110 talented photographers with 75 top photo editors, publishers, curators, gallery owners and video producers, for the 8th annual New York Portfolio Review on March 27, 28 and 29 in New York City. Applications are now open for the free New York Portfolio Review, which is produced by The New York Times photo department, the Craig Newmark Graduate School of Journalism at the City University of New York and United Photo Industries. Participation is open to anyone over 18 years old, and all types of photography will be considered. The deadline is Tuesday November 19, 11:59 p.m. Eastern Time.

title: Yannick Nzet-Sguin Takes Over the Mets Young Artist Program
description: The conductor Yannick Nzet-Sguin, who became the music director of the Metropolitan Opera last season, said on Friday that he had decided to take on a larger role nurturing its next generation of talent by leading the companys prestigious young artist program.

title: California Emerged From Drought and Is Still Catching Fire
description: California residents hit a milestone in March: for the first time in eight years the state was officially out of a drought. That drought, atop years of record breaking temperatures, had helped spur the creation of enormous wildfires. Many wondered if 2019 would be a quieter wildfire season.

title: General Motors, California, World Series: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Emilio Nicolas Sr., 88, a Creator of Univision, Dies
description: Emilio Nicolas Sr., who built a struggling Texas television station into the company that became the Spanish-language broadcasting juggernaut Univision, died on Oct. 12 at his home in San Antonio. He was 88.

title: Halloween: Nooses and Blackface Decorations Prompt Backlash
description: Depictions of children hanging from nooses were displayed across the street from an elementary school in Brooklyn. An empty noose swung from a home on Long Island. And in Rockland County, N.Y., three black pumpkins with white eyes, noses and mouths sat on the steps of a small law firm.

title: In Fire-Scarred California, If Youre Told to Go, You Go
description: [Sign up for our daily newsletter about news from California.]

title: Bernie Parrish, All-Pro Cornerback Who Took on the N.F.L., Dies at 83
description: Bernie Parrish, an All-Pro defensive back for the Cleveland Browns in the 1960s who in retirement tried to organize N.F.L. players into a Teamsters-backed union and wrote a book critical of the league, died on Wednesday at his home in Springfield, Mo. He was 83.

title: Microsoft Wins Pentagons $10 Billion JEDI Contract, Thwarting Amazon
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The Department of Defense on Friday awarded a $10 billion technology contract to Microsoft over Amazon in a contest that was closely watched after President Trump ramped up his criticism of Amazons founder, Jeff Bezos, and said he might intervene.

title: The Trump Impeachment Inquiry: What Happened Today
description: Impeachment investigators are in talks with a lawyer for John Bolton about bringing the mustachioed former national security adviser in for a closed-door deposition. I talked to my colleague Peter Baker, who is writing a story on Mr. Boltons potential role in the impeachment inquiry, about what could make him a valuable witness.

title: Leroy Johnson, Barrier-Breaking Georgia Politician, Dies at 91
description: Leroy R. Johnson, a prominent Georgia politician who in 1962 became the first black candidate elected to that states Senate since Reconstruction, died on Oct. 24 in Atlanta. He was 91.

title: Lebanon Battles to Be Born at Last
description: BEIRUT  Lebanon was ahead of the game on civil war and now is last to the Arab Spring, or at least an Arab something  a vast, united exhalation of disgust at the thievery, corruption and nepotism that has caused widespread misery across this wounded land.

title: PGA Tour, With Tiger Woods in Tow, Tries to Win Over Japan
description: INZAI, JAPAN  Yasuo Shiina left his home in Tokyo at dawn Thursday to get a spot at the 10th tee of the Accordia Golf Narashino Country Club, about 90 minutes away. Shiina plays a round or so a month and watches lots of golf on television. But he has never seen the likes of Tiger Woods, Rory McIlroy and Jason Day up close.

title: Morales Averts Runoff in Bolivia, Officials Say, but Anger and Doubt Remain
description: Bolivias electoral tribunal announced late Friday that President Evo Morales had won this weeks presidential election by a margin large enough to avoid a runoff, a finding that incensed the opposition and raised international doubts about a race that has been dogged by allegations of fraud.

title: Has M.L.B.s Ball Lost Its Juice? Some Players Think So
description: WASHINGTON  Robinson Chirinos, the Houston Astros catcher, has the best vantage point during games to evaluate every play. So trust his judgment in joining a chorus of people befuddled about how the baseballs themselves are behaving this postseason.

title: Giuliani, Overheard Talking About Need for Cash, Mistakenly Calls NBC Reporter
description: WASHINGTON  Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trumps personal lawyer and a key figure in the impeachment inquiry, managed to inadvertently telephone an NBC News reporter at 11 p.m. one night this month and leave a lengthy voice message filled with snippets of an overheard conversation.

title: E.A. Carmean,Who Forsook a Life in Art for the Church, Dies at 74
description: E.A. Carmean Jr., a museum curator and director and modern art expert who, responding to a higher calling midway through his career, entered a seminary and became an Episcopal canon, died on Oct. 12 at his home in Washington. He was 74.

title: Don Valentine, Founder of Sequoia Capital, Is Dead at 87
description: Don Valentine, a venture capitalist who founded Sequoia Capital, a Silicon Valley venture capital firm that helped cement the areas rise as a technology hub, died on Friday at his home in Woodside, Calif. He was 87.

title: Why Will Breitbart Be Included in Facebook News?
description: With a presidential election looming, it seems everyone is trying to get inside Mark Zuckerbergs head.

title: Giuliani Is Drawing Attention to Hunter Bidens Work in Romania. But Theres a Problem.
description: WASHINGTON  Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trumps personal lawyer, signaled this month that he planned to open a new front in his attacks against former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr.  work done by Mr. Bidens son Hunter Biden for a wealthy Romanian business executive facing corruption charges.

title: Swing Set Susan Threatened to Arrest Hispanic Teens. Instead, She Was Charged.
description: A white woman from Texas who was seen berating and threatening to arrest a group of Hispanic teenagers for playing at a park in a widely shared video was charged this week with impersonating a public servant, the police said.

title: Elizabeth Warren Wants to Lose Your Vote
description: A decade ago, it was conventional wisdom that the world would soon start running low on oil and that the United States would henceforth be at the mercy of the inexorable trend. Then the fracking revolution came about, and the U.S. resumed its long-lost place as the worlds No. 1 oil and natural gas producer.

title: Women Get an Unwanted Surprise by Mail: Youre Pregnant! (Theyre Not.)
description: Chelcie Gettes mother called her early Tuesday morning to tell her she had gotten something in the mail. The two went on FaceTime and opened it together. It was a cute little card congratulating me for my soon-to-be baby, Ms. Gette, 27, said.

title: For the Nationals, a Former Bat Boy Mixes Numbers and Tradition
description: WASHINGTON  His job was to make life easier for the best baseball players in the world. For seven seasons, starting at age 16, Sam Mondry-Cohen worked in the visitors clubhouse in San Francisco, shining cleats, hauling equipment, filling coffee orders. At game time he would be the bat boy, in full uniform, as he was for the Washington Nationals the night Barry Bonds broke the career home run record in 2007.

title: Hot Spots?
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Im not going to lie, I needed this after yesterdays nail-biter. Sam Trabucco always makes very elegant, whimsical puzzles, and todays is no exception. That didnt mean it was humdrum, but it was extremely smooth and clean and a fairly swift solve for me.

title: Key Witness in Impeachment Inquiry Asks Federal Court to Rule Over Testifying
description: WASHINGTON  A key witness in the impeachment investigation filed a lawsuit Friday asking a federal judge to rule on whether he can testify, a move that raises new doubts about whether President Trumps closest aides, like the former national security adviser, John R. Bolton, will be able to cooperate with the inquiry.

title: Corrections: October 26, 2019
description: ARTS

title: Quotation of the Day: The Federal Budget Deficit Is Projected to Surpass $1 Trillion Next Year
description: The current levels of debt are unprecedented in peacetime during a growing economy, and the consequences of this irresponsible spending are unknown.

title: Trump Administration Cuts Flights to Most Cuban Airports
description: WASHINGTON  The Transportation Department announced Friday that it would suspend flights from the United States to nine airports in Cuba beginning in December. The policy will sever air service to every international airport there except the one in Havana.

title: Nets Edge Knicks in First New York Matchup of the Season
description: In the seasons first installment of the N.B.A.s answer to the Subway Series, the Nets held off the Knicks, 113-109, on Friday night.

title: Rachel Maddow Confronts Her NBC News Bosses Live, on the Air
description: The MSNBC anchor Rachel Maddow publicly confronted the leadership of her own network on Friday night, declaring live on air that she and other NBC News employees had deep concerns about whether the organization had stymied Ronan Farrows reporting on the movie mogul Harvey Weinstein.

title: Brooklyn Shooting: Police Kill Man After He Critically Injures Officer
description: The police fatally shot a Brooklyn T-shirt vendor in a nail salon on Friday after he used a chair to hit an officer who was trying to arrest another man, officials said. The officer, who was hit on the head during the altercation, was hospitalized in critical but stable condition, officials said.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: BoJack Horseman and Saturday Night Live
description: BOJACK HORSEMAN Stream on Netflix. This talking horse has certainly had his ups and downs over the course of this series, often sabotaging his own success with drugs, alcohol and other destructive behaviors. But as the show enters its final season, BoJack (Will Arnett) seems to be on the path toward accepting responsibility by entering rehab. Elsewhere in Hollywoo, Diane (Alison Brie), Princess Carolyn (Amy Sedaris), Todd (Aaron Paul) and Mr. Peanutbutter (Paul F. Tompkins) grapple with their own definitions of happiness as their brightly colored animated world changes around them. The show, a sendup of Hollywood, will also tackle film franchises, mergers and unionization efforts. These eight episodes serve as Part 1 of the final sixth season, with Part 2 coming Jan. 31.

title: How a Rooftop Meadow of Bees and Butterflies Shows N.Y.C.s Future
description: Tall grasses glow in the afternoon sunlight. The last bees and butterflies of the season hover over goldenrod and asters. Silver orbs that look like alien spacecrafts shimmer nearby.

title: Panic in Pakistani City After 900 Children Test Positive for H.I.V.
description: RATODERO, Pakistan  Nearly 900 children in the small Pakistani city of Ratodero were bedridden early this year with raging fevers that resisted treatment. Parents were frantic, with everyone seeming to know a family with a sick child.

title: Hitler or Hcke? Germanys Far-Right Party Radicalizes
description: BERLIN  It was a stunt but it was revealing. Lawmakers of the far-right Alternative for Germany were read quotations and then asked: Were these penned by Bjrn Hcke, the partys most notorious far-right firebrand  or by Hitler?

title: Nate Diaz Passed Drug Test and Can Fight Next Week, U.F.C. Says
description: A day after Nate Diaz said he would not fight in his upcoming Ultimate Fighting Championship bout at Madison Square Garden because he was told he had tested positive for a banned substance  an allegation that he made public and vehemently denied in a single tweet  officials said he was all clear.

title: In Hungary, Viktor Orban Showers Money on Stadiums, Less So on Hospitals
description: FELCSUT, Hungary  The Pancho Arena stands about 20 yards from the country home of Viktor Orban, Hungarys prime minister. The professional soccer stadium has a heated pitch, a museum, a spotless medical clinic and 3,814 seats, double the population of the surrounding village.

title: While California Fires Rage, the Rich Hire Private Firefighters
description: LOS ANGELES  You can now add firefighting to the list of the ways that the wealthy are different from the rest of the world.

title: Warrens Education Plan, and Why High-Stakes Testing Seems Here to Stay
description: On Monday, Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts released a plan for K-12 education. It is expansive and expensive, calling for hundreds of billions of dollars in funding for impoverished children, aggressive efforts to promote racial integration, and sharp limits on federal support for charter schools.

title: Symbol of 80s Greed Stands to Profit From Trump Tax Break for Poor Areas
description: RENO, Nev.  In the 1980s, Michael Milken embodied Wall Street greed. A swashbuckling financier, he was charged with playing a central role in a vast insider-trading scheme and was sent to prison for violating federal securities and tax laws. He was an inspiration for the Gordon Gekko character in the film Wall Street.

title: Secret Deal Helped Housing Industry Stop Tougher Rules on Climate Change
description: WASHINGTON  A secret agreement has allowed the nations homebuilders to make it much easier to block changes to building codes that would require new houses to better address climate change, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times.

title: The Impeachment Inquiry This Week in 6 Developments
description: More damning testimony. A Republican resistance emerges and so does the Deep State. Steve Bannon is back and so is Anonymous. So many developments  so little time. Its O.K., well recap the week for you.

title: Running Away, and Finding Solace in Art
description: When George Nkrumah Meizah was growing up in Ghana, he would watch American movies and wonder what it would be like to live in the United States.

title: Its One of Autumns Best Scents, but Not Everyone Smells It
description: Sugar, red and Japanese Maples: You can drive up and down Americas east coast to enjoy their fiery pyrotechnic shows each fall. Along the way, you may want to hop out of the car, take a deep breath and hope you catch a whiff of the katsura trees sweet scent.

title: Memorializing Tragedy at a Pittsburgh Synagogue Through Faith, History and Good Works
description: PITTSBURGH  In early September, James Young, an international expert in public memorials, came to speak to the local Jewish community.

title: Donald Trumps Gift to Mitt Romney: Relevance
description: WASHINGTON  I dont feel that theres a need to be careful at this stage of my life, said Senator Mitt Romney, who seems intent on proving as much these days.

title: Kickball Umpire Sues South Carolina Mayor, Saying He Was Fired Over a Call
description: The home team, trailing 5-1 in a recreational league kickball game for adults, had put runners on first and second with two outs in the bottom of the eighth inning.

title: Thanksgiving Getaway: Going Someplace Other Than Grandmothers House
description: For millions of Americans, Thanksgiving means Dads famous gravy, tryptophan-fueled naps and chance encounters with former high school classmates. For others, Thanksgiving means tropical cocktails and butter-soft sand.

title: Were Asking You to Dig Deep: Biden Seeks to Steady Finances as Allies Fret
description: Steve Ricchetti, one of Joseph R. Biden Jr.s closest confidantes, is reaching out to wary donors to shore up support. The Biden presidential campaign is watching costs  some staff members are sleeping at homes of volunteers  and facing criticism for spending on chartered jets. Mr. Bidens team is also urging allies to redouble fund-raising efforts before the calendar turns to 2020 and he has fewer days to devote to the money trail.

title: Tim Ryan Out, Polls at Odds: This Week in the 2020 Race
description: And then there were 18, which was still larger than the presidential field in any other year.

title: In Afghanistans War and Peace, WhatsApp Delivers the Message
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When hundreds of Taliban fighters surrounded the district center of Bala Murghab in western Afghanistan in early April, the Afghan troops stationed there knew they were in peril. They couldnt reach their own commandos. American air support was their last hope.

title: Real Wedding Day Looks
description: A traditional aso oke for a Nigerian wedding. A kimono for a Japanese tea. A red lehenga for a Hindu ceremony. The men and women featured in our wedding announcements (and other couples) wore outfits that told many stories, some of personal style and others of cultural traditions. Here is a selection of photographs from their weddings, with details on their purchases.

title: Bonding Over Politics, Religion and a Dog Named Henry
description: Hannah Elizabeth Brown and Jared Michael Bond were married Oct. 26 at the Indiana Statehouse in Indianapolis. The Rev. Matthew R. Barnes, a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: In the Heart of America, a Long-Distance Love
description: Kirsten Lynn Milliard and Jesus Armando Osete were married Oct. 26 at Holy Trinity Catholic Church in Lenexa, Kan. The Rev. Gerard Alba, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Rugby World Cup: England Upsets New Zealand in Stunner
description: YOKOHAMA, Japan  One of the first questions put to England Coach Eddie Jones after his team dominated the near-unanimous favorite to win a third Rugby World Cup semifinal in succession was where Englands victory over New Zealand ranked in its rugby history.

title: Getting Ready for the New York City Marathon
description: Welcome to the Running newsletter! Every Saturday morning, we email runners with news, advice and some motivation to help you get up and running. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.

title: Maria Butina, Deported to Moscow, Is Defiant: Russians Dont Give Up
description: MOSCOW  Maria Butina, the gun-loving Russian who befriended prominent Republicans during the 2016 presidential campaign and ended up imprisoned in Florida, landed in Moscow on Saturday, a day after she was deported.

title: Pan Am Remains Grounded. In Culture, That Is.
description: On Oct. 26, 1958, Pan American World Airways made the first commercial nonstop flight from New York to Paris. A marching band played John Philip Sousa as guests boarded the plane, where 111 passengers supped on cuisine from Maxims in Paris. Twenty-five years later, the airline commemorated the voyage by inviting celebrities like Eartha Kitt and the boxing champ Floyd Patterson to Paris in one of the original Boeing 707 jets. Once there, the crew was feted at a party.

title: PG&E Shuts Off Power in Northern California as Residents Flee Fires
description: HEALDSBURG, Calif.  Popular downtown boutiques and farm-to-table restaurants were deserted in Healdsburg, Calif., by Saturday afternoon. Traffic ground to a halt in downtown Windsor, where lines for gas stations spilled into gridlocked roadways. The county fairgrounds in Santa Rosa once again morphed into a disaster base camp.

title: Pocketbook Woes Drive an Unlikely Comeback in Argentine Presidential Race
description: BUENOS AIRES  Four years ago, Mauricio Macri persuaded working class Argentines like Hugo Taboada that it was time to end 17 years of economic mismanagement and brazen graft by the countrys leftist leaders, a shift that propelled him to an upset victory as president.

title: Noise Complaint: The Bar Downstairs Blasts Music All Night!
description: Q: After moving into a fourth-floor apartment in a Washington Heights co-op, we discovered that the innocuous-looking bar on the ground floor turns into a raging nightclub from midnight until 4 a.m. Nothing drowns out the bass  not ear plugs, not white-noise machines, not even the soundproof windows we installed. Weve complained repeatedly to management, which tells us they are sending notice, but nothing changes. The board president recently said nothing could be done. But the bar is a tenant of the co-op. Doesnt the board have a say over its tenants behavior?

title: A Racist Attack Shows How Whiteness Evolves
description: Two 17-year-old boys accused of harassing four African-American middle schoolgirls using racial slurs and urinating on one of the victims  are facing charges including bias intimidation and lewdness.

title: Economic Incentives Dont Always Do What We Want Them To
description: At least since Adam Smith and his famous Bs (It is not from the benevolence of the butcher, the brewer, or the baker that we expect our dinner, but from their regard to their own self-interest.), a fundamental premise of economics has been that financial incentives are the primary driver of human behavior. Over the last few decades, this faith in the power of economic incentives led policymakers in the United States and elsewhere to focus, often with the best of intentions, on a narrow range of incentive-compatible policies.

title: Boris Johnson Is Heading for a Scorched-Earth Election
description: News update: On Tuesday, Prime Minister Boris Johnson won a vote to hold a general election on Dec. 12.

title: Zack Greinke Lays the Foundation for an Astros Comeback
description: WASHINGTON  It is rare for a World Series to go three games without a win by the home team. That is how it stands now, after the Washington Nationals won twice in Houston, then squandered nearly all of their chances at home on Friday in a 4-1 loss to the Astros in Game 3.

title: Official Says Attempts to Rally Top State Officials Behind Ukraine Ambassador Failed
description: WASHINGTON  A top diplomat told impeachment investigators on Saturday that he repeatedly pressed top State Department leaders, in vain, to defend the United States ambassador to Ukraine in the face of false attacks that he said were orchestrated by the presidents personal lawyer Rudolph W. Giuliani.

title: 11 New Recipes You Dont Want to Miss
description: This weekend, make peanut butter-miso cookies (above), citrus-glazed pork chops, fluffy Cheddar biscuits or any of the new recipes in the collection below.

title: Even Eagles Have Data Roaming Limits, Researchers Find
description: Frequent fliers often find themselves with hefty phone bills, and global travelers can drain their roaming data allowance. But eagles?

title: Michael Milkens Career
description: Greed, for lack of a better word, is good. Greed is right. Greed works. Those are the words of Gordon Gekko, a character in the 1987 film Wall Street, who was partly inspired by Michael Milken. Mr. Milken, who became known as the billionaire king of junk bonds, was the face of avarice in the 1980s. After serving time in prison, he has gone on to other ventures.

title: Thanks, Whistle-Blower, Your Work Is Done
description: Virtually every assertion he made has been corroborated on the record by the administration or other officials and witnesses.

title: A Corner of Washington, United by the Nationals (and Blue Sharks)
description: WASHINGTON  Hours before the World Series officially returned to this city for the first time in 86 years, the roiling red waves rolled in.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Todays passage is by a modern comedic actress and writer I would call beloved, Mindy Kaling, from her Why Not Me? memoir. Ms. Kaling is famous for the American version of The Office, as well as her own show, The Mindy Project, various other series and movies, and a few best sellers. Shes a quintessential Everywoman trying to make her way in an appearance-obsessed society, to humorous effect.

title: Waiting for Bolton: A Capital Speculates on What He Will Say
description: WASHINGTON  The message that John R. Bolton, President Trumps former national security adviser, sent supporters of his newly reopened political action committee last week raised as many questions as it answered in a capital consumed by impeachment.

title: The E.P.A., on Asbestos
description: To the Editor:

title: Could Trump Serve a Second Term if Ousted? Its Up to the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  With chances rapidly increasing that President Trump will be impeached by the House and tried in the Senate, an intriguing question has reared its head: Could he be ousted only to try to return to the White House in 2020 in a Trumpian bid for redemption and revenge?

title: Worlds Largest Treehouse Burns to the Ground
description: In the last few days, Harold Burgess, the creator of the worlds largest treehouse, has been taking calls from mourners all over the world who had made pilgrimages to the 97-foot-tall wooden structure in Crossville, Tenn.

title: Hong Kong Protests Spread to U.S. Colleges, and a Rift Grows
description: For much of the year, Frances Hui followed the Hong Kong demonstrations from her dorm room at Emerson College, feeling guilty that she was safe in Boston while clashes grew increasingly violent for her fellow Hong Kongers.

title: U.K. Truck Driver Charged With Manslaughter in Deaths of 39
description: LONDON  A 25-year-old man was charged on Saturday with manslaughter and a trafficking conspiracy in connection with the deaths of 39 people whose bodies were found in a refrigerated truck in southeastern England, the Essex Police said.

title: Democratic Candidates Rebuke Trump at Criminal Justice Forum
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  One day after President Trump claimed he had done more for black voters than the Obama administration had, several Democratic presidential candidates spoke at the same historically black college on Saturday and issued a blistering rebuke of both the president and the events organizers  whom they accused of giving Mr. Trump an undeserved platform.

title: Choosing to Be Vulnerable With My Patients
description: When I was a third-year medical student in Baltimore, one of my first patients was a 20-something intravenous drug user. Thin and unkempt, an orange Orioles cap shadowing his heavily-tattooed face, he had a serious infection and needed to stay in the hospital for several days. It was not his first time being hospitalized.

title: Who Is Bill Barr?
description: The attorney general? Trumps protector? Both?

title: Against the Superhero Regime
description: Two interesting things have been happening in the world of film over the last month. A relatively low-budget, no-special effects movie that places Batmans Joker in a version of Martin Scorseses decaying 1970s-era New York City has become one of the most successful American movies of the year  with clouds of political outrage trailing in its wake. And everyone on the internet is yelling at, about, or in defense of Scorsese himself, because the aging director told an interviewer that superhero movies arent real cinema.

title: Were Less and Less a Christian Nation, and I Blame Some Blowhards
description: Perhaps for the first time since the United States was established, a majority of young adults here do not identify as Christian.

title: Extra, Extra! Prez Wont Read All About It
description: WASHINGTON  My first job in journalism was as a clerk at The Washington Star. I fielded a lot of calls from readers threatening to cancel their subscriptions  including, on occasion, my mom.

title: IoG: Internet of Ghouls
description: Pours rings of salt around your bed at night when it detects spikes in paranormal activity. Available in pairs of two, four and 666.

title: Human Scum, Lynching and Trumps Tortured English
description: You campaign in poetry, according to a popular saying, and govern in prose.

title: Catholic Bishops Back Ordination of Married Men as Priests in Amazon Region, a Milestone
description: VATICAN CITY  A summit of Roman Catholic bishops meeting at the Vatican recommended on Saturday that Pope Francis allow the ordination of married men as priests in the Amazon region, which would lift a roughly 1,000-year-old restriction and potentially revolutionize the priesthood.

title: Kelly Says He Told Trump a Yes Man as His Successor Would Lead to Impeachment
description: WASHINGTON  John F. Kelly, the former White House chief of staff who during his tenure made it clear he detested the job, expressed regret on Saturday about leaving and implied that he could have helped stave off the impeachment inquiry now threatening Mr. Trumps presidency.

title: Pyongyangs Retro Sci-Fi Architecture
description: In July 2015, the two of us stepped off a plane at the newly opened airport in Pyongyang, North Korea. It was our first time in the country. As architects based in Beijing, we were well acquainted with the worlds cities and skyscrapers, but North Korea was a dark spot in our mental map  filled in, as it was for most people, by preconceptions and stereotypes that rendered the so-called Hermit Kingdom in black and white. We had tried to leave those ideas behind, but we didnt expect that this first visit would leave us with such a sense of confusion, one where the difference between what was real and genuine was muddled by what was ostensibly staged or faked.

title: Clueless and Saved by the Bell Are How We Got Trump
description: I remember sitting in physics class on the first day of the World Trade Organization protests in Seattle in 1999. I was a senior, still 17, and wed been hearing for weeks that a huge and bad anarchist riot was coming to destroy our town, with tanks and bricks and garbage fires and naked bicyclists and people dressed as turtles. Turtles! The Gap was on high alert!

title: California Fires Updates: Up to 2.7 Million Will Lose Power
description: Pacific Gas and Electric expanded its power blackout zone to include 940,000 customers on Saturday, as the extreme weather conditions heightened the risk that sparks from its equipment could ignite wildfires throughout the utilitys service area.

title: Keep the Oil: Trump Revives Charged Slogan for New Syria Troop Mission
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has offered several justifications for an American withdrawal from Syria. He has dismissed the country as nothing but sand and death, discounted its American-backed Kurdish fighters as no angels, and argued that he is winding down endless wars.

title: How the Astros Won Game 4 of the World Series
description: WASHINGTON  Alex Bregman held his bat in the air with his left hand and walked five paces down the first-base line, his head turned to watch the final landing spot of a baseball he had launched toward Capitol Hill.

title: How Sweet it Is!
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  This puzzle with pinstripes, titled How Sweet It Is!, is not about The Honeymooners. Instead, Michael Paleos has provided us with a tightly-constructed but extravagant confection, lighthearted and riffy, until you take a closer look and realize how much choreography is really behind it.

title: The Deep State Exists to Battle People Like Trump
description: For the last two weeks, diplomats have been walking through secure doors in the basement of the United States Capitol, defying the objection of their politically appointed superiors as they answer questions from members of the House impeachment inquiry.

title: A Player With Shoulder Pain, and a League Happy to Turn Its Back
description: The Jets are their usual dispiriting mess on the field, but in the executive suites their leaders sound testosterone-infused, insisting that their players manifest the manly virtues of playing through pain.

title: Iraqi Protesters Flood Baghdad Square Despite Violent Crackdown
description: BAGHDAD  Masked and black clad security forces fired barrages of pepper spray, tear gas and sound bombs into crowds of antigovernment protesters in a central Baghdad square for hours on Saturday evening, timing their assault at one point to a shutdown of electricity that left the area enveloped in darkness.

title: Pilots Watched Video Feed of Lavatory From Cockpit, Flight Attendant Says
description: When a Southwest Airlines flight attendant entered the cockpit during a flight and saw an iPad showing what appeared to be live footage from the planes lavatory, one of the pilots assured her it was a top secret security measure, according to court documents. Now, the airline denies there was ever a camera at all.

title: Quotation of the Day: Panic in Pakistani City After 900 Children Test Positive for H.I.V.
description: It seems it is Gods affliction on us. How could so many of our children have such a terrible disease?

title: No Regrets: Hong Kongs Protesters Test Chinas Limits
description: HONG KONG  Fat Boy is a college dropout with a youthful blush of acne who excels at playing video games and lives with his mother. He is also a wily commander who leads a ragtag band of protesters willing to risk injury and arrest as they face off against the police.

title: Liana Rowe, Justin Kamen
description: Liana Rowe and Justin Kamen were married Oct. 26 at the Pavilion at Sunken Meadow in Kings Park, N.Y. Valerie Rowe, the brides mother who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

Archie Jones Sr., a Baptist minister and the paternal grandfather of the groom, performed the ceremony, with Leah Piper, a friend of the couple, taking part at Brantley Farms, an organic beef farm owned by the grooms family.

title: Teresa Gianotti, John Bohrer
description: Teresa Mildred Gianotti and John Robert Bohrer were married Oct. 26 at St. Charles Borromeo Roman Catholic Church in Brooklyn. The Rev. Kevin M. Smith, a Roman Catholic priest and a cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony.

description: Danielle Sarah Tell and Hart Gabriel Comess-Daniels are to be married Oct. 27 at the Calhoun Beach Club in Minneapolis. The grooms father, Rabbi Neil S. Comess-Daniels, is to officiate.

title: Special Operations Raid Said to Kill Senior Terrorist Leader in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  United States Special Operations commandos carried out a risky raid in northwestern Syria on Saturday against a senior terrorist leader there, two senior administration officials said late Saturday.

title: Samantha Chassin, Alexander Meyer
description: Samantha Lynne Chassin and Alexander Little Meyer were married Oct. 26 at Blue Hill at Stone Barns, a restaurant in Tarrytown, N.Y. Rabbi Paula L. Feldstein officiated.

title: Dagney Pruner, Carlos Gmez del Campo Neme
description: Dagney Devlin Pruner and Carlos Gmez del Campo Neme were married Oct. 25 in a civil ceremony at the Cipriani restaurant in Mexico City, in a ceremony led by Judge Juana Emilia Soler. On Oct. 26, the Rev. Ramn A. Hevia, a Roman Catholic priest, performed a nuptial mass in the chapel at Colegio de San Ignacio de Loyola Vizcanas, a preparatory school in Mexico City.

title: Audrey Almy, Sean Hawks
description: Audrey Ellen Almy and Sean Edmund Hawks were married Oct. 26 at the Arctic Club, a hotel in Seattle. Elaine M. Way, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Patricia Hurtado de Mendoza, Alexis Abril
description: Patricia Hurtado de Mendoza and Alexis Augusto Abril were married Oct. 25 at the Islamorada Fish Company, an events space in Islamorada, Fla. The Rev. Steve Vetter, a Baptist minister, officiated.
